suspensio: <entryFree id="n47121" type="main" key="suspensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suspendo, I. B. 3.</etym>, <sense id="n47121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an arching</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vaulting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arched work</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10</bibl>; cf. the foll. art.—</sense><sense id="n47121.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The imperfect pronunciation</hi> of a letter: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae m,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 1, 31, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suspensura: <entryFree id="n47122" type="main" key="suspensu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspensūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an arching</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vaulting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arched work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an arch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">balneorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">caldariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cellarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 40, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suspensus: <entryFree id="n47123" type="main" key="suspensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suspendo.</entryFree>
suspicabilis: <entryFree id="n47124" type="main" key="suspi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suspicor</etym>, <sense id="n47124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conjectural</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ars (medicina),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suspicax: <entryFree id="n47125" type="main" key="suspi^cax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspĭcax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">apt to suspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distrustful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspicious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47125.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">populus suspicax ob eamque rem mobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47125.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that excites mistrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspicious</hi>: <cb n="SUSP" /> silentium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:29:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 29, 2</bibl> (dub.; bracketed by Haase).</sense></entryFree>
suspicio: <entryFree id="n47126" type="main" key="suspi^ci^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>spexi, spectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sub-specio</etym>. <sense id="n47126.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look up at</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n47126.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum caelum suspeximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum de gurgite caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces qui neque videntur a nobis neque ipsi nos suspicere possunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 81</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: nubes suspexit Olympus, <hi rend="ital">looked up at</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rose into the clouds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 477</bibl>: quae tuam matrem (i. e. Pleiadem) tellus a parte sinistrā Suspicit, <hi rend="ital">which looks</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is situated towards</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 840</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspexit in caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 3</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec suspicit nec circumspicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:34:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 34, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formare vultus, respicientes, suspicientesque et despicientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47126.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n47126.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to look up to</hi> a thing with the mind, <hi rend="ital">to raise the thoughts up to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil altum, nihil magnificum ac divinum suspicere possunt, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47126.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to look up to</hi> with admiration, <hi rend="ital">to admire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, etc. (opp. despicere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 25</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. stupeo): eos viros suspiciunt maximisque efferunt laudibus, in quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicit potentem humilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:126:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 126, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam (with admirari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 72, 148</bibl></cit>: honores praemiaque vestra, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum et marmor vetus aeraque et artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47126.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look at secretly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">askance;</hi> hence, by meton. (effectus pro causā), <hi rend="ital">to mistrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspect</hi> (perh. only in participles; and most freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Bomilcar suspectus regi et ipse eum suspiciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 70, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">suspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to suspicio, II.), <hi rend="ital">mistrusted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspected; that excites suspicion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47126.6" n="a" level="4"> Of persons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere aliquem falso suspectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo quis versutior et callidior est hoc invisior et suspectior detractā opinione probitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia de morbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne super tali scelere suspectum se haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 71:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 71, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quādam causā suspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in morte matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eā (filiā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspectus societate consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:35:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 35, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspecti capitalium criminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimiae spei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Licinius Proculus intimā familiaritate Othonis suspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aemulationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:9:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non clam me est, tibi me esse suspectam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meis civibus suspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum filius jamjam patri suspectus esset de novercā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 25, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomine neglegentiae suspectum esse alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: suspectissimum quemque sibi haud cunctanter oppressit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 6</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspectus consilia ejus fovisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47126.7" n="b" level="4"> Of things, concr. and abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">(in tyrannorum vitā) omnia semper suspecta atque sollicita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael, 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(voluptas) invidiosum nomen est, infame, suspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quae suspecta erant, certa videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suspecto loco,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>uncertain</tr>, <tr>critical</tr>, <tr>dangerous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eā parte consedit, quae suspecta maxime erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus Ambiguis suspectus aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuit accipiter Suspectos laqueos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspectae horae (quartanae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:8:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua frigida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 37, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissum suspectius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 14</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi medicina pluribus suspecta et invisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspectam facit judici causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 51</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudele, suos addicere amores: Non dare, suspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 618</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47126.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspicious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distrustful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidi et suspecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Dist. 4, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47127" type="main" key="suspi_ci^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspīcĭo</orth> (in good MSS. and edd. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">suspītĭo</orth>; v. Brambach s. v.; Fleckeis. in Rhein. Mus. viii. p. 225 sqq.; and so always in Plaut. and Ter. acc. to Fleck., and in Cic. acc. to B. and K.; but cf. contra Corss. Ausspr. 2, 359 sq.), ōnis. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. suspicio</etym>, <sense id="n47127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mistrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspicion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47127.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: improborum facta primo suspitio insequitur,<pb n="1821" /> <cb n="SUSP" />  deinde sermo atque fama, tum accusator, tum judex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitionem et culpam ut ab se segregent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta nunc suspitio de me incidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: redeunti ex ipsā re mi incidit suspitio; <cit><quote lang="la">hem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā re nulla subest suspitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat porro nemo, in quem ea suspitio conveniret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quem ne si insidiis quidem interfectus esset, ulla caderet suspitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitionem populi sensit moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suspitionem alicui venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:7:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 7, § 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 33, 81</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suspitionem cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augetur Gallis suspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitionem levare atque ab se removere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:59:section=136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 59, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem suspitione exsolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem offensionem suspitionis de aliquo deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: suspitionem falsam saeviter ferre, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 511, 5</bibl> (Trag. v. 349 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">maligna insontem deprimit suspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicione si quis errabit suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, prol. 45</bibl></cit>: audimus eum venisse in suspitionem Torquato de morte Pansae, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> ad Brut. 1, 6, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amore haec omnia insunt vitia: injuriae, Suspitiones, inimicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae causae suspitionum offensionumque dantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad has suspiciones certissimae res accederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si minus honestas suspitiones injectas diluemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:16:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 16, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47127.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in suspitione ponatur stupri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit> (Ussing, suspicione): <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem suspitionem amoris transferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui suspitionem ficte reconciliatae gratiae dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suspitionem avaritiae venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suspitionem conjurationis vocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:4:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in suspitionem incidit regni appetendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli subita suspitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:7:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 7, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expellere aliquem suspitione cognationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli suspicione interpositā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare timoris aliquam suspicionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebit enim suspicionem adulterii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res minime firmam suspitionem veneni habet,</quote> <trans><tr>excites</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 174</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47127.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitio est mihi, nunc vos suspicarier, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tum erat suspitio, Dolo malo haec fieri omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addit fuisse suspitionem, veneno sibi conscivisse mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde nata suspicio est, quasi desciscere a patre temptasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47127.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n47127.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A notion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggestion</hi> (very rare; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio, conjectura): deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 62</bibl></cit>: suspitione attingere intellegentiam aut maris aut terrae, id <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 25, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitionem nullam habebam te rei publicae causā mare transiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, D, 1.—</sense><sense id="n47127.6" n="2" level="3"> Objectively, <hi rend="ital">an appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indication</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quam suspicionem infirmitatis daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā suspicione vulneris laesus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 94 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulsa quae suspicionem tantum possit habere dulcedinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 15, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suspiciose: <entryFree id="n47128" type="main" key="suspi_ci^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspīcĭōsē</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">suspit-</orth>, v. suspicio <sense id="n47128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>suspiciosus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">in a way to raise mistrust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suspicion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspiciously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminose ac suspitiose dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3</bibl> prooem.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitiosius aut criminosius dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 131</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> seems not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
suspiciosus: <entryFree id="n47129" type="main" key="suspi_ci^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspīcĭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">suspīt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. suspicio</etym>, <sense id="n47129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of suspicion</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n47129.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mistrustful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready to suspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspicious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes quibus res sunt minus secundae, magis sunt nescio quomodo Suspitiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an te conscientia timidum suspitiosumque faciebat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:29:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 29, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitiosus esse in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitiosa ac maledica civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita anxia, suspiciosa, trepida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 15:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 15, 2</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 64</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47129.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That excites mistrust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suspicion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspicious</hi>: si suspiciosus fuisset, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:12:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 12, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suspiciosum Cato hoc in loco suspectum significat, non suspicantem, Gell. ib.: timor, perturbatio, etc. ... quae erant ante suspitiosa, haec aperta ac manifesta faciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod adhuc est suspitiosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: quia id est <cb n="SUSP" /> suspitiosum, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt, quae suspitiosum crimen efficiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:33:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 33, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">joci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitiosissimum negotium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> seems not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
suspiciter: <entryFree id="n47130" type="hapax" key="suspi_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspīcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>suspicio</etym>, <sense id="n47130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mistrustfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspiciously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspiciter circum aspicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 360, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suspico: <entryFree id="n47131" type="main" key="suspi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. suspicor <sense id="n47131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
suspicor: <entryFree id="n47132" type="main" key="suspi^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (<sense id="n47132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> suspicarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 49</bibl>), 1, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [1. suspicio, II.], <hi rend="ital">to mistrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspect</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n47132.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">id est, quod suspicabar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc suspicare aut invenis De illā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid homines suspicentur, videtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod velim temere atque injuriose de illo suspicati sint homines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil mali suspicans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res nefarias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 23, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum nefas suspicatus de uxore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 80</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with a personal object: <cit><quote lang="la">ancillas meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 250, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47132.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi> (so most usually): <cit><quote lang="la">suspitio est mihi, nunc vos suspicarier, Me idcirco haec promittere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes ilico Me suspicentur, credo, habere aurum domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debere se suspicari, simulatā Caesarem amicitiā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id consilium cum fugae causā initum suspicaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:16" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venturos, Qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 83</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47132.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuge suspicari (sc. me),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47132.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to suspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surmise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conjecture</hi> (class.; cf.: opinor, reor). </sense><sense id="n47132.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">di inmortales, spem insperatam date mihi, quam suspicor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 22</bibl></cit> Brix: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidem hic lenonis ejus't vidulus, quem suspicor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi me animus fallit, hic profecto'st anulus, quem ego suspicor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, quae vix conjectura, qualia sint, possumus suspicari, sic affirmat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figuram divinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiddam de L. Crasso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de M. Popilii ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 56</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47132.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare, quā sint illae dignitate, potes ex his suspicari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne suspicari quidem, quanta sit admirabilitas caelestium rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:36:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 36, 90</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47132.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">objectclause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navalis hostis ante adesse potest, quam quisquam venturum esse suspicari queat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (magnitudines stellarum) esse numquam suspicati sumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placiturum tibi esse librum meum suspicabar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde suspicor fore, ut infringatur hominum improbitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicor ingenuas erubuisse genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19</bibl></cit> (20), 6: <cit><quote lang="la">ex loco tumuli suspicari, non esse monumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 34</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut suspicor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 22</bibl></cit> Ritschl.?*! <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">suspĭco</orth>, āre: <cit><quote lang="la">ne suspices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suspiratio: <entryFree id="n47133" type="main" key="suspi_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspīrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suspiro</etym>, <sense id="n47133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fetching a deep breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sigh</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">suspiratione sollicitudinem fateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:158" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 158</bibl></cit>: inde illa nobilis M. Ciceronis suspiratio: O te felicem, M. Porci, etc., Plin. H. N. praef. § 9.</sense></entryFree>
suspiratus: <entryFree id="n47134" type="main" key="suspi_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspīrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sigh</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare); in <number>plur.</number>: suspiratibus haustis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 129</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 3</bibl>, the correct read. is suspiritu).</sense></entryFree>
suspiriosus: <entryFree id="n47135" type="main" key="suspi_ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspīrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suspirium</etym>, <sense id="n47135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">breathing deeply</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with difficulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breathing short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">asthmatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:38:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anhelatores et suspiriosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 2, 5, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 8, 29, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:28:148" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 28, 148</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suspiritus: <entryFree id="n47136" type="main" key="suspi_ri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspīrĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>suspiro</etym>, <sense id="n47136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breathing deeply</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with difficulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a deep breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sigh</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">enicat suspiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit> (14 Ritschl): <cit><quote lang="la">quem nemo aspicere sine suspiritu posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspiritus et gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longos trahens suspiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 207</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suspirium: <entryFree id="n47137" type="main" key="suspi_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspīrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deep breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sigh.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47137.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">suspirium alte petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traxit ex intimo ventre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrum suspirium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: si quis est in rerum naturā sine sollicitudine, sine suspirio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:34:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 34, 72</bibl>: idque ab exercitu <cb n="SUST" /> cum suspirio videretur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Pers. 11</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos numquam pungunt suspiria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit> (4, 7), 27: <cit><quote lang="la">repetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:61" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere ab imo Pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:402" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 402</bibl></cit>; 2, 125; 2, 774; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 537: cessant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:13:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 13, 19</bibl></cit>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:110:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 110, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47137.2" n="B" level="2"> As a disease, <hi rend="ital">shortness of breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">asthma</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">morbus, qui satis apte dici suspirium potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 54:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 54, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspirio laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 38, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47137.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a breathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respiration</hi> (in post-Aug. poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">nec dat suspiria cursus Vulneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:928" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 928</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:328" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 328</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:221" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 221</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suspiro: <entryFree id="n47138" type="main" key="suspi_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspīro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n47138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [subspiro]. </sense><sense id="n47138.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to draw a deep breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heave a sigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sigh</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">occulte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiariter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspirat ab imis Pectoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumque ibi suspirat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:707" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspirat sacerdos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 4, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flebile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Eutr. 1, 269</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella in flavo hospite suspirans,</quote> <trans><tr>sighing after</tr>, <tr>longing for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solā suspirat in illā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:417" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 417</bibl></cit>; v. also infra, II.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus atro exundante vapore Suspirans,</quote> <trans><tr>breathing out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:136" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relicto brevi foramine, quo aestuantia vina suspirent,</quote> <trans><tr>may exhale</tr>, <tr>evaporate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 16</bibl></cit>: curae suspirantes, <hi rend="ital">sighing</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:21:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 21, 42</bibl> (Trag. v. 60 Vahl.).—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47138.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n47138.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To breathe out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umentes nebulas (Anauros),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclusum pectore, Bacchum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:779" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 779</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:136" default="NO">12, 136</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47138.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sigh for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspirat longo non visam tempore matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:152" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:5:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chloen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 2, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47138.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sigh out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exclaim with a sigh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandis suspirat arator, incassum manuum cecidisse labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1164</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrona et adulta virgo Suspiret, eheu! ne, etc. ( = sollicita est, ne),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suspitio: <entryFree id="n47139" type="main" key="suspi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. suspicio <sense id="n47139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
susquedeque: <entryFree id="n47140" type="main" key="susque de_que"><orth extent="full" lang="la">susque dēque</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>subs for subque, and de-que</etym>, <sense id="n47140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">both up and down</hi>, to express indifference: susque deque fero aut susque deque habeo (his enim omnibus modis dicitur) ... significat autem susque deque ferre animo aequo esse, et quod accidit non magni pendere, atque interdum neglegere et contemnere: et propemodum id valet, quod dicitur Graece <foreign lang="greek">a)diaforei=n.</foreign> Laberius in Compitalibus: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tu lentus es: nunc tu susque deque fers ... M. Varro in Sisenna vel de historiā: quod si non horum omnium similia essent principia ac postprincipia, susque deque esset. Lucilius in tertio: verum haec ludus ibi susque omnia deque fuerunt: susque et deque fuere, inquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 9, 1</bibl></cit> sqq.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=290" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 290</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae neque sunt facta, neque ego in me admisi, arguit: atque id me susque deque esse habituram putat. Non edepol faciam: neque me perpetiar probri Falso insimulatam,</quote> <trans><tr>that I shall bear it with indifference</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Octavio susque deque,</quote> <trans><tr>it is of no consequence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sustentaculum: <entryFree id="n47141" type="main" key="sustenta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sustentācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sustento</etym>, <sense id="n47141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47141.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sustentaculum, columen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47141.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sustenance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nourishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustentaculum sumptuosum corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mor. Eccl. Cath. 33" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mor. Eccl. Cath. 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sustentatio: <entryFree id="n47142" type="main" key="sustenta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sustentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n47142.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A deferring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay; forbearance</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n47142.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">habere aliquam moram et sustentationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sustentatio sui recte patientia nominatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 18, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47142.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">a figure of speech where the orator defers the mention of something</hi>, keeping the hearer in doubt, <hi rend="ital">a suspension</hi>, Cels. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47142.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sustenance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintenance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:3:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 3, 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sustentatus: <entryFree id="n47143" type="main" key="sustenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sustentātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a holding up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sustaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">levia sustentatui, gravia demersui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 287, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus ille sustentatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sustento: <entryFree id="n47144" type="main" key="sustento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sustento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>sustineo</etym>, <sense id="n47144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upriqht</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to uphold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi> (syn. sustineo). </sense><sense id="n47144.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">multos per annos Sustentata ruet moles et machina mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 96</bibl></cit>: Hercule quondam<pb n="1822" /> <cb n="SUST" />  Sustentante polum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alcanor fratrem ruentem Sustentat dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Tiberim abjectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naufraga sustentant ... vela (i. e. navem) Lacones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 222</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aegre seque et arma sustentans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47144.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47144.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to keep up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uphold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uplift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi> (class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n47144.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">exsanguem jam et jacentem (civitatem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecillitatem valetudinis tuae sustenta et tuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo sustentatur notitiā sui corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 24, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 114, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Terentiam, unam omnium aerumnosissimam, sustentes tuis officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu velim tete tuā virtute sustentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me una consolatio sustentat, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 36, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnis difficultates animo me sustentavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: litteris sustentor et recreor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarā conscientiā sustentor, cum cogito, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius intellegit, C. Catonem a Crasso sustentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisconsultus, non suo artificio sed alieno sustentatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos suos fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua spes reliqua est, quae fortium civium mentes cogitationesque sustentet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes inopiam sustentabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica magnis meis laboribus sustentata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus Trojanas sustentat opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 609</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa virum meritis sustentat fama tropaeis,</quote> <trans><tr>upholds</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arminius manu, voce, vulnere sustentabat pugnam,</quote> <trans><tr>kept up</tr>, <tr>maintained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 65</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47144.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47144.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi> by food, money, or other means: <cit><quote lang="la">familiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset silvestris beluae sustentatus uberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem (aër) spiritu ductus alit et sustentat animantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se subsidiis patrimonii aut amicorum liberalitate sustentant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo (frumento) sustentata est plebs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustentans fovensque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucios largitione et curā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus nullā re egens aletur et sustentabitur isdem rebus, quibus astra sustentantur et aluntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">furtim rapta sustentat pectora terra,</quote> <trans><tr>refreshes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:875" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 875</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parsimoniam patrum suis sumptibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuitatem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egestatem et luxuriem domestico lenocinio sustentavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Red. Sen. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Glycera venditando coronas sustentaverat paupertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 125</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut milites pecore ex longinquioribus vicis adacto extremam famem sustentarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B.G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">mutando sordidas merces sustentabatur,</quote> <trans><tr>supported himself</tr>, <tr>got a living</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 13</bibl></cit>; for which in the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form: <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Valuistin' bene? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Sustentavi sedulo, <hi rend="ital">I have taken good care of myself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have kept myself in good case</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 8</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">impers. pass.: Ge.</hi> Valuistin' usque? <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Sustentatum'st sedulo, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 14</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47144.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To keep in check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites, paulisper ab rege sustentati, paucis amissis profugi discedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. aciem, Auct. B. Afr. 82: aquas, Auct. Cons. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 221</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47144.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi> (rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: fero, patior): miserias plurimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moerorem doloremque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (sc. morbum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">procellas invidiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegre is dies sustentatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum auxiliis atque opibus, si qua bella inciderint, sustentare consuerint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegre eo die sustentatum est,</quote> <trans><tr>a defence was made</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:104:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 104, 2</bibl></cit>: impetus legionum, Auct. B. Hisp. 17, 3. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, nisi in tempore subventum foret, ultra sustentaturi fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 18, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47144.9" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi> (Ciceron.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. prolato): rem, dum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 64, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificationem ad tuum adventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id (malum) opprimi sustentando ac prolatando nullo pacto potest ... celeriter vobis vindicandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 405</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sustinentia: <entryFree id="n47145" type="main" key="susti^nenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sustĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen><etym>sustineo</etym>, <sense id="n47145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an endurance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 34, 7</bibl></cit>: spei, Vulg. <cb n="SUST" /> 1 Thess. 1, 3.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">patience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endurance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sustineo: <entryFree id="n47146" type="main" key="susti^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sustĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>tĭnŭi, tentum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>subs for sub, and teneo</etym>, <sense id="n47146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold upright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uphold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi> (syn. fulcio). </sense><sense id="n47146.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47146.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">onus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum hominum terra sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Milo umeris sustineret bovem vivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma membraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 45, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:8" default="NO">7, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmos baculo artus,</quote> <trans><tr>to support</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furcis spectacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenuā speculum manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornice exstructo, quo pons sustinebatur, Auct. B. Alex. 19, 4: manibus clipeos et hastam Et galeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix populum tellus sustinet illa suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 182: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis albus Pocula cum cyatho duo sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas ad sustinenda opsonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 49, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër volatus alitum sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>: lacus omnia illata pondera sustinens, <hi rend="ital">bearing</hi> on its surface, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce populus Romanus universus veluti duobus navigiis inpositus binis cardinibus sustinetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum pluribus adminiculis fulcit ac sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to support one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se a lapsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 411</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47146.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi>, etc. (syn.: refreno, supprimo, moror): currum equosque, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 63</bibl></cit> (v. infra, II. B. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:302" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustinet a jugulo dextram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 750</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a jugulo nitentem sustinet hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:648" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina Threiciā lyrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit> (4, 1, 42): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc agendo, nunc sustinendo agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud simile miraculum eos sustinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:398" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perterritum exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:100" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab omni assensu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to refrain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a respondendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32, 104</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeres vias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to halt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 794" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 794</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47146.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47146.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to uphold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem et decus civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 34, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">causam publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tris personas unus sustineo,</quote> <trans><tr>characters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personam magistri,</quote> <trans><tr>to personate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid muneris in rem publicam fungi ac sustinere velitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:86:section=199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 86, § 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiam veterem atque antiquam haec mea senectus sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 100</bibl></cit>: vitam, Maecen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101, 11</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(arbor) ingentem sustinet umbram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 297</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47146.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47146.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, by food, money, or other means: <cit><quote lang="la">hac (sc. re frumentariā) alimur et sustinemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:5:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem amicum suum labentem excepit, fulsit et sustinuit re, fortunā, fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ager non amplius hominum quinque milia potest sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus munificentiā sustineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc patriam parvosque nepotes Sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitates aliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 65, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penuriam temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47146.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undergo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure; to hold out against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withstand</hi> (so most freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: fero, tolero, patior): mala ferre sustinereque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tu scis, quantum malarum rerum sustineam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocens suspitionem hanc sustinet causā meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:39:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B.
