C. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.38" n="c" level="4"> In oblique clauses introduced by <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or clauses subordinate to such: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassius constituit ut ludi absente te fierent suo nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulat ut ad hanc suam praedam tam nefariam adjutores vos profiteamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nasidius eos magnopere hortatur ut rursus cum Bruti classe, additis suis (i.e. Nasidii) auxiliis confligant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(regem) denuntiasse sibi ut triduo regni sui decederent finibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 25, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinae mulieres, hinc patres, hinc viros orantes, ne parricidio macularent partus suos (i.e. mulierum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Patron praecepit suis ut arma induerent, ad omne imperium suum parati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:11:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">reflex. pron.</hi>, referring to a different antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hanc (Laidem) Demosthenes clanculum adit, et ut sibi copiam sui faceret, petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.39" n="d" level="4"> In subordinate clauses introduced by <hi rend="ital">quin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Dejotarus) non recusat quin id suum facinus judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 15, 43</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">16, 45: parietes hujus curiae tibi gratias agere gestiunt, quod futura sit illa auctoritas in his majorum suorum et suis sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidni gauderet quod iram suam nemo sentiret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 3:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querenti quod uxor sua e fico se suspendisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 88</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with intentional ambiguity: cum Proculejus quereretur de filio quod is mortem suam expectaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 68</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.40" n="e" level="4"> In interrogative clauses: <cit><quote lang="la">si, quod officii sui sit, non occurrit animo, nihil umquam omnino aget,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non auderet iterum dicere quot milia fundus suus abesset ab urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1825" /> <cb n="SUUS" /> 28: <cit><quote lang="la">donec sciat unisquisque quid sui, quid alieni sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 27, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex ignarus, quae cum Hannibale legatis suis convenisset, quaeque legati ejus ad se allaturi fuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam animadvertit quantus agminis sui terror esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 19, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47174.41" n="2" level="3"> In a virtually oblique clause. </sense><sense id="n47174.42" n="a" level="4"> In final clause, introduced by <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi>, referring to the subject of the purpose: <cit><quote lang="la">me a portu praemisit domum, ut haec nuntiem uxori suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi Appius ille Caecus viam muniverit, non quā populus uteretur, sed ubi impune sui posteri latrocinarentur, i. e. Appii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae gens ad Caesarem legatos mise. rat, ut suis omnibus facultatibus uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde castra movent, ne qua vis sociis suis ab Romano exercitu inferri possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romani) Albam a fundamentis proruerunt, ne memoria originum suarum exstaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidani nuntios Romam, qui certiorem de suo casu senatum facerent, misere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 33, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto intervallo ab hostibus consedit, ut nec adventus suus propinquitate nimia nosci posset, et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Datames locum delegit talem ut non multum obesse multitudo hostium suae paucitati posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si gubernator a diis procellas petat ut gratior ars sua periculo fiat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:25:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 25, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.43" n="b" level="4"> In other dependent clauses represented as conceived by an antecedent in the principal sentence: <cit><quote lang="la">Sulla, si sibi suus pudor ac dignitas non prodesset, nullum auxilium requisivit ( = negavit se defendi velle, si, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paetus omnes libros quos frater suus reliquisset mihi donavit ( = dixit se donare libros quos, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim a te emit, sed, priusquam tu suum sibi venderes, ipse possedit ( = potitus est, ne, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africanus, si sua res ageretur, testimonium non diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille ipse (Pompejus) proposuit epistulam illam, in quā est Pro tuis rebus gestis amplissimis. Amplioribusne quam suis, quam Africani?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus dabat (Manlio) quod ... vinculorum suorum invidiam dictator fugisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Numa) Camenis eum lucum sacravit, quod earum ibi concilia cum conjuge suā Egeriā essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens deos omnis invocare ad gratiam illi pro se referendam, quoniam sibi nequaquam satis facultatis pro suo animo atque illius erga se esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 50, 4</bibl></cit> (cf. D. 1. a. infra).</sense><sense id="n47174.44" n="D" level="2"> In the place of ejus. </sense><sense id="n47174.45" n="1" level="3"> In clauses virtually oblique, but with indicative, being conceived by the antecedent (hence suus, not ejus), but asserted as fact by the author (hence indicative, not subjunctive): <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero tibi mandat ut Aristodemo idem respondeas, quod de fratre suo (Ciceronis) respondisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oriundi ab Sabinis, ne, quia post Tatii mortem ab suā parte non erat regnatum, imperium amitterent, sui corporis creari regem volebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Caesar villam pulcherrimam, quia mater sua aliquando in illā custodita erat, diruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:21:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philemonem, a manu servum, qui necem suam per venenum inimicis promiserat, non gravius quam simplici morte punivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo excandescunt si quid e jubā suā decisum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.46" n="2" level="3"> To avoid ambiguity: <cit><quote lang="la">petunt rationes illius (Catilinae) ut orbetur consilio res publica, ut minuatur contra suum (i.e. Catilinae) furorem imperatorum copia (instead of ejus, which might be referred to res publica),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 39, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites a cornibus positos, cum jam pelleretur media peditum suorum acies, incurrisse ab lateribus ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 37, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.47" n="3" level="3"> Colloquially and in epistolary style suus is used emphatically instead of ejus, with the meaning <hi rend="ital">own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiar</hi>: deinde ille actutum subferret suus servus poenas Sosia, <hi rend="ital">his own slave</hi> (opp. Mercury, who personates Sosias), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 19</bibl>: mira erant in civitatibus ipsorum furta Graecorum quae magistratus sui fecerant, <hi rend="ital">their own magistrates</hi> ( = ipsorum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (litteris Bruti) unum alienum summā suā prudentiā (est), ut spectem ludos suos,</quote> <trans><tr>his peculiar prudence</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quod quidem ille (Nero) decernebat, quorumdam dolo ad omina sui exitus vertebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. II. A. 1. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">g;</foreign> II. <cb n="SUUS" /> A. 2. a. <foreign lang="greek">b;</foreign> II. B. 3.—</sense><sense id="n47174.48" n="4" level="3"> Without particular emphasis (mostly ante- and post-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tum erit tempestiva cum semen suum maturum erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis si macra erit, sarmenta sua concidito minute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sic purgatus erit, diuturnā valetudine utatur, neque ullus morbus veniet, nisi sua culpa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cimon in eandem invidiam incidit quam pater suus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quā ratione consecutus sit (Lysander) latet. Non enim virtute sui exercitus factum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lys. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse sub Esquiliis, ubi erat regia sua, Concidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:601" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodque suus conjux riguo collegerat horto, Truncat olus foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 646</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:819" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 819</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n47174.49" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47174.50" n="A" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47174.51" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sui</orth>, <itype>suorum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">his</hi>, <hi rend="ital">their</hi> (etc.) <hi rend="ital">friends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellow-beings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adherents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">followers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partisans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">family</hi>, etc., of persons in any near connection with the antecedent. </sense><sense id="n47174.52" n="(a)" level="5"> (Corresp. to the regular usage, I. A. B. C.) Cupio abducere ut reddam (i.e. eam) suis, <hi rend="ital">to her family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friends</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 77</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum animus societatem caritatis coierit cum suis, omnesque naturā conjunctos suos duxerit,</quote> <trans><tr>fellow-beings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:23:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 23, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier ingeniosa praecepit suis omnia Caelio pollicerentur,</quote> <trans><tr>her slaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo facilius et nostras domos obire, et ipse a suis coli possit,</quote> <trans><tr>his friends</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā gratiam beneficii vestri cum suorum laude conjungant,</quote> <trans><tr>their family</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem hanc contemptionem pecuniae suis reliquisset,</quote> <trans><tr>to his posterity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum divisurum se urbem palam suis polliceretur,</quote> <trans><tr>his partisans</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar, cohortatus suos, proelium commisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Curio exercitum reduxit, suis omnibus praeter Fabium incolumibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar receptui suorum timens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certior ab suis factus est, praeclusas esse portas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium suorum consensu, Curio bellum ducere parabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 37</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">Pompejus suorum omnium hortatu statuerat proelio decertare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar Brundisium ad suos severius scripsit,</quote> <trans><tr>to his officers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naviculam conscendit cum paucis suis,</quote> <trans><tr>a few of his followers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum cum suis consiliandi causā secreto praeter consuetudinem loqueretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nupsit Melino, adulescenti inprimis inter suos et honesto et nobili,</quote> <trans><tr>his equals</tr>, <tr>associates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex raptim a suis in equum impositus fugit,</quote> <trans><tr>his suite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidio suorum proelium restituere,</quote> <trans><tr>comrades</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:52:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 52, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras bestias ... ad opem suis ferendam avertas,</quote> <trans><tr>their young</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstulit sibi in suos potestatem,</quote> <trans><tr>his slaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:12:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Besso et Nabarzani nuntiaverant sui regem ... interemptum esse,</quote> <trans><tr>their fellow - conspirators</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12, 14</bibl></cit>. — Very rarely <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut bona mens suis omnibus fuerit. Si quem libido abripuit, illorum eum, cum quibus conjuravit, non suum judicet esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.53" n="(b)" level="5"> Irregular use (acc. to I. D.): sui = ejus amici, etc. (freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">the absolute use of ejus in this sense being inadmissible): quasi vero quisquam dormiat? ne sui quidem hoc velint, non modo ipse (sui = ejus amici, liberi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is (annus) ejus omnem spem ... morte pervertit. Fuit hoc luctuosum suis, acerbum patriae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigas, quia per suos ( = ipsius milites) agendae erant, in primā acie locaverat rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem Pisistrati qui inter suos ( = ejus cives) maxima erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo cum multitudine adversariorum sui superarentur, ipse fuit superior, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 8, 4</bibl></cit>; v. <foreign lang="greek">g.</foreign>—</sense><sense id="n47174.54" n="(g)" level="5"> Without antecedent (cf. I. B. supra): quoties necesse est fallere aut falli a suis, <hi rend="ital">by one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s friends</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 493" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 493</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.55" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭa</orth>, suae. <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sweetheart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistress</hi> (rare): illam suam suas res sibi habere jussit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 28</bibl>. 69: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo quid hic faciet sua?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.56" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and more freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭa</orth>, <itype>suōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, = <hi rend="ital">one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s property.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47174.57" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47174.58" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec suom adimerem alteri,</quote> <trans><tr>his property</tr>, <tr>his own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit> (34): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc si ille salvos revenit, reddam suom sibi (v. D. 3. a. infra),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum studeo quam facillime ad suum pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani hanc esse consuetudinem ut socios sui nihil deperdere velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. Cic. Rab. <cb n="SUUS" /> Post. 11, 3, I. A. 11. supra: <cit><quote lang="la">nec donare illi de suo dicimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; so esp. with quisque; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> — Hence, de suo = per se, or suā sponte; <cit><quote lang="la">(stellae) quae per igneos tractus labentia inde splendorem trahant caloremque, non de suo clara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:1:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.59" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum mihi placebat, illi suum (of a literary essay),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: suom quemque decet, <hi rend="ital">his own manners</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 11</bibl>; so, expendere oportet quid quisque habeat sui (<hi rend="ital">what peculiarities</hi>) nec velle experiri quam se aliena deceant; <cit><quote lang="la">id enim maxime quemque decet quod est cujusque maxime suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.60" n="(g)" level="5"> Jurid. term: aliquid pro suo possidere, <hi rend="ital">to possess in the belief of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s legal right</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro suo possessio tale est, cum dominium nobis acquiri putamus. Et eā causā possidemus ex quā acquiritur, et praeterea pro suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so without an antecedent, and referring to a first person: item re donatā, pro donato et pro suo possideo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:10:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; v. the whole tit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:10" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 42, 10</bibl> (Pro suo); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:67" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 23, 3, 67</bibl>; cf. C., infra <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">similarly: usucapere pro suo = acquire dominion by a possession pro suo, Fragm. Vat. 111: res pro suo, quod justam causam possidendi habet, usucapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:ib. 260" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 260</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 27</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.61" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47174.62" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">One</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s property</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roscius tibi omnia sua praeter animam tradidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui etiam hostibus externis victis sua saepissime reddiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu autem vicinis tuis Massiliensibus sua reddis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Remi legatos miserunt qui dicerent se suaque omnia in fidem atque potestatem populi Romani permittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi milites alveos informes quibus se suaque transveherent, faciebant,</quote> <trans><tr>their baggage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docere eos qui sua permisere fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3</bibl></cit>, praef. 7; so without an antecedent, <hi rend="ital">one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own property</hi> (cf. I. B. 2. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc ob causam maxime ut sua tenerentur res publicae constitutae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 73</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely = eorum res: quod vero etiam sua reddiderint (i.e. Gallis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 55, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.63" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">One</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own affairs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena ut melius videant et dijudicent Quam sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoscunt ... immobile agmen et sua quemque molientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 20, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ei hostium non secus quam sua nota erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 41, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena cum suis perdidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, referring to a <hi rend="ital">noun fem.</hi>: sua (finxit) C. Cassius ( = suas persuasiones; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the context),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 90</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n47174.64" n="B" level="2"> Predicative uses: suum esse, facere, fieri, putare, etc., like a <hi rend="ital">gen. poss.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">etc.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the property</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">under the dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power of</hi> the antecedent. </sense><sense id="n47174.65" n="1" level="3"> Of property in things. </sense><sense id="n47174.66" n="(a)" level="5"> Corporeal: <cit><quote lang="la">scripsit causam dicere Prius aurum quare sit suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil erat cujusquam quod non hoc anno suum fore putabat (Clodius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 32, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia suum cujusque fit, eorum quae naturā fuerant communia quod cuique obtigit, id quisque teneat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juba suam esse praedicans praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratum sibi populum facturum, si omnes res Neapolitanorum suas duxissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 32, 8</bibl></cit>: libros esse dicimus Ciceronis; <cit><quote lang="la">eosdem Dorus librarius suos vocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum enim istarum personarum nihil suum esse possit,</quote> <trans><tr>since these persons can own nothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:96" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 96</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 7, 15</bibl> pr.—Virtually predicative: <cit><quote lang="la">referas ad eos qui suam rem nullam habent ( = rem quae sua sit),</quote> <trans><tr>nothing of their own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in potestate nostrā est, nihil suum habere potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:84" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 84</bibl></cit>. — ( <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> ) Of literary works: <cit><quote lang="la">quae convenere in Andriam ex Perinthiā Fatetur transtulisse, atque usum pro suis ( = quasi sua essent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest autem ... quae tum audiet ... ingenue pro suis dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>his own thoughts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.67" n="(g)" level="5"> Of a country or people: <cit><quote lang="la">suum facere = suae dicionis facere: commemorat ut (Caesar) magnam partem Italiae beneficio atque auctoritate eorum suam fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quam (Asiam) jam ex parte suam fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelissima ac superbissima gens sua omnia suique arbitrii facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 44, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.68" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia sua putavit quae vos vestra esse velletis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non meminit, illum exercitum senatūs populique Romani esse, non suum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <pb n="1826" /> <cb n="SUUS" /> probavit, non rempublicam suam esse, sed se reipublicae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:19:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 19, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of incorporeal things: hi si velint scire quam brevis eorum vita sit, cogitent ex quotā parte sua sit,</quote> <trans><tr>how much of it is their own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 19:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 19, 3</bibl></cit>; so, suum facere, <hi rend="ital">to appropriate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentis est, id quod in quoque optimum est, si possit, suum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeremus quomodo animus (hanc virtutem) usu suam faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.69" n="2" level="3"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n47174.70" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Under a master</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s</hi> or <hi rend="ital">father</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s control</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut lege caverent, ne quis quem civitatis mutandae causā suum faceret, neve alienaret,</quote> <trans><tr>make any one his slave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: quid eam tum? suamne esse ajebat, <hi rend="ital">his daughter</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">in his power?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eduxit mater pro suā ( = quasi sua esset),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.71" n="(b)" level="5"> Reflexively = sui juris, <hi rend="ital">independent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own master</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not subject to another</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s control</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own control</hi> (v. sui juris, infra): <cit><quote lang="la">ancilla, quae mea fuit hodie, sua nunc est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.72" n="(g)" level="5"> Of moral power over others: suus = <hi rend="ital">devoted</hi> to one: <cit><quote lang="la">hice hoc munere arbitrantur Suam Thaidem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos hic fecit suos Paulo sumptu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed istunc exora, ut (mulierem) suam esse adsimulet,</quote> <trans><tr>to be friendly to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Antonio sic agens ut perspiciat, si in eo negotio nobis satisfecerit, totum me futurum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 1</bibl></cit> a, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpheus ... utebatur populo sane suo,</quote> <trans><tr>devoted to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 7, 29</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: vota suos habuere deos, <hi rend="ital">the vows</hi> (inst. of the persons uttering them) <hi rend="ital">had the gods on their side</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 373</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.73" n="(d)" level="5"> Of power over one's self, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam qui sciet ubi quidque positum sit, quāque eo veniat, is poterit eruere, semperque esse in disputando suus,</quote> <trans><tr>self-possessed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inaestimabile bonum est suum fieri,</quote> <trans><tr>selfcontrol</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 75, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(furiosus) qui suus non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:4:7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 4, 7, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix sua, vix sanae virgo Niseia compos Mentis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 35</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.74" n="3" level="3"> Suum est, as <hi rend="ital">impers. predicate</hi>: = ejus est, <hi rend="ital">characteristic of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiar to</hi> one (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dixit antea, sed suum illud est, nihil ut affirmet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 99</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n47174.75" n="C" level="2"> Attributive usages, almost always (except in Seneca) with suus before its noun. </sense><sense id="n47174.76" n="1" level="3"> The property, relations, affairs, etc., of one opposed to those of another, <hi rend="ital">own.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47174.77" n="a" level="4"> Opposition expressed: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de suo casu, multa de vestro querebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua sibi propiora pericula quam mea loquebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:18:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 18, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suasque et imperatoris laudes canentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 38, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatione collegae et suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 35, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Senecae fratris morte pavidum et pro suā incolumitate pavidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut pro Vitellio conquerentes suum dolorem proferebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. alienus: ut suo potius tempore mercatorem admitterent, quam celerius alieno,</quote> <trans><tr>at a time convenient to themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 11</bibl></cit>. —Without antecedent, opp. externus: <cit><quote lang="la">(Platoni) duo placet esse motus, unum suum, alterum externum, esse autem divinius quod ipsum ex se suā sponte moveatur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:12:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 12, 32</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.78" n="b" level="4"> Implied: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem suis se finibus tenere jubeamus,</quote> <trans><tr>within the limits assigned to it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vobis immortale monumentum suis paene manibus senatus ... exstruxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superiores (amnes) in Italiā, hic (Rhodanus) trans Alpes, hospitales suas tantum, nec largiores quam intulere aquas vehentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 224</bibl></cit>: colligitur aqua ex imbribus; <cit><quote lang="la">ex suo fonte nativa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennas ambo non habuere suas (non suas = alienas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 24</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.79" n="c" level="4"> In particular phrases. ( <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> ) Suā sponte and suo Marte, <hi rend="ital">of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own accord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without the suggestion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">influence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, etc., of others: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar bellum contra Antonium suā sponte suscepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suā sponte ad Caesarem in jus adierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 87</bibl></cit>.—So of things, = per se, <hi rend="ital">by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for its own sake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus et omne honestum suā sponte expetendum (cf. in the context: per se igitur jus est expetendum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:18:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: justitium suā sponte inceptum priusquam indiceretur, <hi rend="ital">by itself</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">without a decree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7, 8</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sortes suā sponte attenuatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 1, 11</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 38, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 14, 4</bibl>, I. A. 2., supra): rex enim ipse, suā sponte, nullis commentariis Caesaris, simul atque audivit<cb n="SUUS" />  ejus interitum suo Marte res suas recuperavit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.80" n="(b)" level="5"> Suus locus, in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">restitit suo loco Romana acies (opp. to the advance of the enemy),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—So figuratively: <cit><quote lang="la">et staturas suo loco leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem instruxit primum suis locis, pauloque a castris Pompeji longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 84</bibl></cit> (cf.: suo loco, 7. b. <foreign lang="greek">g,</foreign> infra).—</sense><sense id="n47174.81" n="(g)" level="5"> For suo jure v. 3. infra.—</sense><sense id="n47174.82" n="(d)" level="5"> Sua Venus = one's own Venus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">good luck</hi> (v. Venus): ille non est mihi par virtutibus, nec officiis; <cit><quote lang="la">sed habuit suam Venerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:28:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 28, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.83" n="2" level="3"> Of private relations (opp. to public): <cit><quote lang="la">ut in suis rebus, ita in re publicā luxuriosus nepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde ut communibus pro communibus utatur, privatis ut suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod oppidum Labienus suā pecuniā exaedificaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militibus agros ex suis possessionibus pollicetur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>his private property</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:6:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 6, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.84" n="3" level="3"> Of just rights or claims: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatori senatuique honos suus redditus,</quote> <trans><tr>due to them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque inpedimento fuit, quominus religionibus suus tenor suaque observatio redderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus omnibus debetur suus decor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 41</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">So distributively: is mensibus suis dimisit legionem,</quote> <trans><tr>in the month in which each soldier was entitled to his discharge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 41, 8</bibl></cit>. — Esp.: suo jure (so, meo, nostro, tuo, etc., jure), <hi rend="ital">by his own right</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tullus Hostilius qui suo jure in portā nomen inscripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum rerum hic A. Licinius fructum a me repetere prope suo jure debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 8, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam illum res publica suo jure esset ulta,</quote> <trans><tr>by its unquestionable right</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 33, 88</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.85" n="4" level="3"> Of that to which one is exclusively devoted: <cit><quote lang="la">huic quaestioni suum diem dabimus,</quote> <trans><tr>a day for its exclusive discussion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:52" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homini autem suum bonum ratio est,</quote> <trans><tr>his exclusive good</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 76:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in majorem me quaestionem vocas, cui suus locus, suus dies dandus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:46:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 2, 46, 1</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">With proprius: mentio inlata apud senatum est, rem suo proprio magistratu egere,</quote> <trans><tr>that the business needed a particular officer exclusively for itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Hannibalem suo proprio occupandum bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 38, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dissupasset hostes, ni suo proprio eum proelio equites Volscorum exceptum tenuissent,</quote> <trans><tr>in which they alone fought</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 70, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare habet suas venas quibus impletur,</quote> <trans><tr>by which it alone is fed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:14:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 14, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.86" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">According to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s liking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own choice.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47174.87" n="a" level="4"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">devoted to</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Milone occiso (Clodius) habuisset suos consules,</quote> <trans><tr>after his own heart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 33, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegit ipse se contra suum Clodium,</quote> <trans><tr>his dear Clodius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 12, 27</bibl></cit> (cf.: suum facere, habere, II. B. 2. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>).— </sense><sense id="n47174.88" n="b" level="4"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">favorable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47174.89" n="(a)" level="5"> Of place: neque Jugurtham nisi ... suo loco pugnam facere, <hi rend="ital">on his own ground</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">chosen by him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 61, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic magna auxilia expectabant et suis locis bellum in hiemem ducere cogitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam nostris locis laboravimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.90" n="(b)" level="5"> Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Perseus suo maxime tempore et alieno hostibus incipere bellum posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 43, 3</bibl></cit>; v. 7. <foreign lang="greek">b,</foreign> infra. — </sense><sense id="n47174.91" n="c" level="4"> Of circumstances: sua occasio, <hi rend="ital">a favorable opportunity;</hi> sometimes without antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">neque occasioni tuae desis, neque suam occasionem hosti des,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum abfuit ut ex incommodo alieno sua occasio peteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 58, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestuque suo Locros trajecit,</quote> <trans><tr>a favorable tide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:41:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 41, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoranti quem portum petat nullus suus ventus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orba suis essent etiamnunc lintea ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ille Ventis iturus non suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:30" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 30</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.92" n="6" level="3"> Of persons or things, <hi rend="ital">peculiar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae est ei (animo) natura? Propria, puto, et sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis enim motus animi suum quendam a naturā habet vultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geometrae et musici ... more quodam loquuntur suo. Ipsae rhetorum artes verbis in docendo quasi privatis utuntur ac suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus omnis habet suum finem,</quote> <trans><tr>its peculiar limits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 61</bibl></cit>: animus cum suum ambitum complevit et finibus se suis cinxit, consummatum est summum <cb n="SUUS" /> bonum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 9:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 9, 3</bibl>: est etiam in nominibus (<hi rend="ital">nouns</hi>) diverso collocatis sua gratia, <hi rend="ital">their peculiar elegance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi non bello aperto, sed suis artibus, fraude et insidiis, est paene circumventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Hannibalem fefellit, suis se artibus peti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus hostem non virtute tantum, sed suis (i. e. hostis) etiam pugnare consiliis oportebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:26" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberam Minucii temeritatem se suo modo expleturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites ovantes sui moris carmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 26, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultans cum sui moris tripudiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 42, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tripudiantes suo more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 26, 9</bibl></cit>.—So, suo Marte, referring to the style of fighting peculiar to the different arms: <cit><quote lang="la">equitem suo alienoque Marte pugnare,</quote> <trans><tr>that the cavalry were fighting both in their own style and in that of the other arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 62, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: suo Marte, 1, c. <foreign lang="greek">a,</foreign> supra.—And distributively ( = suus quisque): <cit><quote lang="la">suos autem haec operum genera ut auctores, sic etiam amatores habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa vero fatidica fulmina ex alto et ex suis venire sideribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 43, § 113</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quidem planiora suis exemplis reddentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit> pröoem.— </sense><sense id="n47174.93" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47174.94" n="a" level="4"> Referring to one's ordinary or normal condition: <cit><quote lang="la">quod certe non fecisset, si suum numerum naves habuissent,</quote> <trans><tr>their regular complement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:51:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 51, § 133</bibl></cit>. — So <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flecte ratem! numerum non habet illa suum,</quote> <trans><tr>its full number</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novus exercitus consulibus est decretus: binae legiones cum suo equitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 36, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum suo justo equitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam (disciplinam) in suum statum redegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillā mente et vultu suo,</quote> <trans><tr>with the ordinary expression of his face</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">media pars aëris ab his (ignibus) submota, in frigore suo manet. Natura enim aëris gelida est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:10:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornuaque in patriis non sua vidit aquis,</quote> <trans><tr>not natural to her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 90</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">So, non suus, of ingrafted branches and their fruit: miraturque (arbos) novas frondis et non sua poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 82</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.95" n="b" level="4"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regular</hi>, etc. (cf. 5. <foreign lang="greek">b,</foreign> supra). </sense><sense id="n47174.96" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The regular time</hi> ( = stato tempore): <cit><quote lang="la">signum quod semper tempore exoritur suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum et recte et suo tempore pepererit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: aestas suo tempore incanduit ... ; <cit><quote lang="la">tam solstitium quam aequinoctium suos dies retulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes venti vicibus suis spirant majore ex parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 48, § 128</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.97" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The right</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proper time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salictum suo tempore caedito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cessit e vitā suo magis quam suorum civium tempore,</quote> <trans><tr>the right time for himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">exstingui homini suo tempore optabile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scandilius dicit se suo tempore rediturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:60:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 60, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Ardeates sua tempora exspectare velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chrysippus dicit, illum ... opperiri debere suum tempus, ad quod velut dato signo prosiliat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:25:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multi exercitus tempore suo victorem hostem pepulerunt!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 39, 4</bibl></cit>. — Without antecedent: sed suo tempore totius sceleris hujus fons aperietur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 15</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de ordine laudis, etc., praecipiemus suo tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.98" n="(g)" level="5"> Suo loco = <hi rend="ital">at the proper place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae erant prudentiae propria suo loco dicta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod reddetur suo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut suo loco dicetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 90, 102, § 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscripta quae suis locis reddam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 20, 2</bibl>; cf. 1, c. <foreign lang="greek">b;</foreign> 4. supra. — </sense><sense id="n47174.99" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Suited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adapted to</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">in eodem fundo suum quidquid conseri oportet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem hanc vendidero pretio suo,</quote> <trans><tr>at a suitable price</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in partes suas digerenda causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confundetur quidquid in suas partes natura digessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:29:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 29, 8</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: haec ego dumque queror, lacrimae sua verba sequuntur, Deque meis oculis in tua membra cadunt, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, i. e. tristia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 67</bibl>.—Without antecedent: suum quidquid genus talearum serito, <hi rend="ital">any fit kind</hi>, i. e. suited to the ground, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.100" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Own</hi>, with the notion of independence of, or dependence on others (cf. B. 2. <foreign lang="greek">g d</foreign>). </sense><sense id="n47174.101" n="a" level="4"> Of political independence: pacem condicionibus his fecerunt ut Capuae suae leges, sui magistratus essent, <hi rend="ital">her own laws</hi>, i. e. not subject to Carthage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 7, 2</bibl>: liberos<pb n="1827" /> <cb n="SUUS" />  eos ac suis legibus victuros, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 23, 4</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Esp. in the phrases suae potestatis or in suā potestate esse, suo jure uti, sui juris esse: Puteolos, qui nunc in suā potestate sunt, suo jure, libertate aequā utuntur, totos occupabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhegini potestatis suae ad ultimum remanserunt,</quote> <trans><tr>retained their self-government</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem ne quam formulae sui juris facerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 9, 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.102" n="b" level="4"> Of paternal authority. </sense><sense id="n47174.103" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Free from the power of the paterfamilias;</hi> in the phrases sui juris esse, suae potestatis esse, <hi rend="ital">to be independent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam personae sui juris sunt, quaedam alieno juri sunt subjectae, Gai,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui juris sunt familiarum suarum principes, id est pater familiae, itemque mater familiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberi parentum potestate liberantur emancipatione. Sed filius quidem ter manumissus sui juris fit, ceteri autem liberi unā manumissione sui juris fiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte patris filius et filia sui juris fiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres familiarum sunt qui sunt suae potestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo defunctus testator suae potestatis mortis tempore fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:147" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 147</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">With indef. reference: si sui juris sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:2:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro suo possideo, 2. a. supra.—Attributively: sui juris arrogatio feminae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 47, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo sui juris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, § 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens numquam semiliber erit: integrae semper libertatis et sui juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non illarum coitu fieri cometen, sed proprium et sui juris esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:12:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: nullique sunt tam feri et sui juris adfectus, ut non disciplinā perdomentur, id. Ira, 2, 12, 3. — </sense><sense id="n47174.104" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subject to paternal authority</hi>, in the phrases suus heres, sui liberi; suus heres, <hi rend="ital">an heir who had been in the paternal power of the deceased</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">CVI SVVS HERES NON SIT, XII. Tab. fr. 5, 4.—In the jurists without antecedent: sui et necessarii heredes sunt velut filius filiave, nepos neptisve ex filiā, deinceps ceteri qui modo in potestate morientis fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:156" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(emancipati liberi) non sunt sui heredes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:2:135" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia facta est juris interpretatio inter suos heredes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:3:15" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datur patrono adversus suos heredes bonorum possessio (where patrono is not the antecedent of suos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:3:41" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui heredes vel instituendi sunt vel exheredandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 22, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accrescunt suis quidem heredibus in partem virilem, extraneis autem in partem dimidiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 17</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Sui liberi, children in paternal power: de suis et legitimis liberis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 55</bibl></cit> inscr.</sense><sense id="n47174.105" n="D" level="2"> In particular connections. </sense><sense id="n47174.106" n="1" level="3"> With ipse, <hi rend="ital">his own</hi>, etc. (cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 696). </sense><sense id="n47174.107" n="a" level="4"> Ipse agreeing with the antecedent of suus, the antecedent being, </sense><sense id="n47174.108" n="(a)" level="5"> A <hi rend="ital">subjectnom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ingenium ejus) valet ipsum suis viribus,</quote> <trans><tr>by its own strength</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio Martia non ipsa suis decretis hostem judicavit Antonium?</quote> <trans><tr>by its own resolutions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruit ipse suis cladibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex scriptis cognosci ipsi suis potuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se ipse suā gravitate et castimoniā defenderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ipse suae civitatis imperium obtenturus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suāmet ipsae fraude omnes interierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 49, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut saeviret ipse in suum sanguinem effecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respicerent suum ipsi exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 52, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 31, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 38, 3</bibl>; 6, 19, 6.—</sense><sense id="n47174.109" n="(b)" level="5"> A <hi rend="ital">subject-acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui dicant eam suā ipsam peremptam mercede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(tribuniciam potestatem) suis ipsam viribus dissolvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 44, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.110" n="(g)" level="5"> An object in <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ut ipsis consistendi in suis munitionibus locus non esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni (hostem) intra suamet ipsum moenia compulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios sua ipsos invidia opportunos interemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 54, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 14, 13</bibl>.—Suus as adjunct of subject (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquando sua praesidia in ipsos consurrexerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>their own garrisons revolted against them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:26:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.111" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of <hi rend="ital">ipse</hi>, strengthening the possessive notion (cf. 4.; <cit><quote lang="la">post-Aug. and very rare, but freq. in modern Lat.): aves (foetus suos) libero caelo suaeque ipsorum fiduciae permittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit> (but tuus ipsius occurs in Cic.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuo ipsius studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuam ipsius amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:4:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 4, § 7</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n47174.112" n="c" level="4"> Both suus and ipse agreeing with the governing noun (very rare; not in Cic. or Cæs.): quae tamen in ipso cursu suo dissipata est (= <cb n="SUUS" /> ipsa in cursu suo), <hi rend="ital">in its very course</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 3</bibl> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">suamet ipsa scelera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 2</bibl></cit> (Dietsch ex conj. ipse): <cit><quote lang="la">suismet ipsis corporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 19, 5</bibl></cit> MSS. (Weissenb. ex conj. ipsi): <cit><quote lang="la">a suismet ipsis praesidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 25, 6</bibl></cit> MSS. (Weissenb. ipsi).—</sense><sense id="n47174.113" n="2" level="3"> With quisque, distributively, <hi rend="ital">each</hi> (<hi rend="ital">every one</hi>) ... <hi rend="ital">his own;</hi> in prose quisque is generally preceded by suus. </sense><sense id="n47174.114" n="a" level="4"> Quisque and suus in different cases. </sense><sense id="n47174.115" n="(a)" level="5"> Quisque as <hi rend="ital">subjectnom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentit enim vim quisque suam quoad possit abuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1033" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1033</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo quisque loco cubet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum quisque noscat ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad suam quisque (me disciplinam) rapiet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod suos quisque servos in tali re facere voluisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum suo quisque auxilio uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeriter ad suos quisque ordines redit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 37</bibl></cit>.—In apposition with <hi rend="ital">plur. subj.</hi> (freq. in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc alii sensus quo pacto quisque suam rem Sentiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnes cives Romani in suis quisque centuriis primā luce adessent,</quote> <trans><tr>that all the Roman citizens should be present</tr>, <tr>each in his own centuria</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc senatus, hinc plebs, suum quisque intuentes ducem constiterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (trigemini) pro suā quisque patriā dimicent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabant compositi suis quisque ordinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 38, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(consules) in suas quisque provincias proficiscuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 26, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suo quaeque (stella) motu naturam suam exercent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 39, 39, § 106</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes, velut dis auctoribus in spem suam quisque acceptis, proelium unā voce poscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 45, 9</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">relictis suis quisque stationibus . . . concurrerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 24, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 44, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 49, 3</bibl>; 2, 38, 6.— </sense><sense id="n47174.116" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> of quisque as <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabrum esse suae quemque fortunae, App. Claud. ap. Ps.-Sall. Ep. ad Caes.
