Rep. c. l.: sui quemque juris et retinendi et dimittendi esse dominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipere se in domos suas quemque jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; and (ungrammatically) <case>nom.</case>, as apposition to a <hi rend="ital">subj.-acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se non modo suam quisque patriam, sed totam Siciliam relicturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 29, 3</bibl></cit> MSS. (Weissenb. ex conj. quosque).— </sense><sense id="n47174.117" n="(g)" level="5"> As adjunct of the <hi rend="ital">subject-nom.</hi>, with a case of quisque as <hi rend="ital">object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attribut. gen.</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sua cujusque animantis natura est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua quemque fraus, suum facinus, suum scelus, etc., de sanitate ac mente deturbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua quemque fraus et suus terror maxime vexat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum cuique incommodum ferendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut solidum suum cuique solvatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne suus cuique domi hostis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sua cuique respublica in manu esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus suus cuique ordinem pugnandi dabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentorium suum cuique militi domus ac penates sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suus cuique (stellae) color est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 18, 16, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahit sua quemque voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat sua cuique dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 467</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47174.118" n="(d)" level="5"> As <hi rend="ital">predicate-nom.</hi> (v. II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem, quae sua cuique conjectanti esse potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) As adjunct of <hi rend="ital">subj.-acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum cuique honorem et gradum redditum gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiam autem suam cujusque artis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 26</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) As adjunct of an object, with a case of quisque as <hi rend="ital">object</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attribut. gen.</hi>: suam cuique sponsam, mihi meam: suum cuique amorem, mihi meum, Atil. Fragm. inc. 1: suom cuique per me uti atque frui licet, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24</bibl> (23), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">ut suo quemque appellem nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placet Stoicis suo quamque rem nomine appellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad suam cujusque naturam consilium est omne revocandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 33, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia quae suum cuique distribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:15:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tribuendo suum cuique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turnus sui cuique periculi recens erat documentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:52:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 52, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in trimatu suo cuique dimidiam esse mensuram futurae certum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 16, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certa cuique rerum suarum possessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:89:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 89, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: qua re suum unicuique studium suaque omnibus delectatio relinquatur, Ps.-<bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Cons. 26, 93</bibl>.—With quemque in apposition with <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Camillus vidit intentos opifices suo quemque operi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 25, 9</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">cujusque</hi> in appos. with <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>: trium clarissimorum suae cujusque gentis virorum<cb n="SUUS" />  mors, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:52:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 52, 7</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">cuique</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi>: sui cuique mores fingunt fortunam hominibus, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11, 6</bibl> (where Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 372</bibl>, reads quique, ex conj.; cf. b. <foreign lang="greek">b,</foreign> infra).—</sense><sense id="n47174.119" n="b" level="4"> Attraction of suus and quisque as adjuncts of nouns. </sense><sense id="n47174.120" n="(a)" level="5"> Attraction of suus: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nemo sit nostrum quin in sensibus sui cujusque generis judicium requirat acrius (= suum cujusque generis judicium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas tamen inter omnes (voces) est suo quoque in genere (vox) mediocris ( = inter omnes voces est mediocris vox, sua quoque in genere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo concilia suae cujusque regionis indici jussit (= sua cujusque regionis concilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 29, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites suae cuique parti post principia collocat (= equites suos cuique parti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum motibus armorum et corporum suae cuique genti assuetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones deducebantur cum tribunis et centurionibus et sui cujusque ordinis militibus (= suis cujusque),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sui cujusque sunt ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 10</bibl></cit> Halm (al. sua): <cit><quote lang="la">sui cujusque ingenii poma vel semina gerunt (= sua cujusque),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and by a double attraction: has (cohortes) subsidiariae ternae et aliae totidem suae cujusque legionis subsequebantur (= has cohortes . . . totidem cujusque legionis, suam quaeque legionem, subsequebantur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 83</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.121" n="(b)" level="5"> Attraction of quisque: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta ibi copia venustatum in suo quique loco sita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit> (al. quaeque): <cit><quote lang="la">quodvis frumentum non tamen omne Quique suo genere inter se simile esse videbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 372</bibl></cit> Lachm. and Munro ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum verba debeant sui cujusque generis copulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:48" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sensibus sui cujusque generis judicium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec igitur proclivitas ad suum quodque genus aegrotatio dicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">separatim greges sui cujusque generis nocte remeabant (= greges sui quisque generis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sui cujusque mensis acciperet (frumentum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and quisque both attracted and in its own case: quia cujusque partis naturae et in corpore et in animo sua quaeque vis sit (where either cujusque or quaeque is redundant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:17:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 17, 46</bibl></cit>; v. Madv. ad loc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so esp. in the phrases suo quoque tempore, anno, die, loco, etc.: pecunia, quae in stipendium Romanis suo quoque anno penderetur, deerat (= suo quaeque anno),</quote> <trans><tr>each instalment in the year when due</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 46, 9</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">suo quoque loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:22:6" default="NO">1, 22, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera quae suis quibusque temporibus anni vilicum exsequi oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo quoque tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi suā quāque die usurae exsolverentur (= suā quaeque die),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:8:section=3" default="NO">13, 7, 8, § 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut opera rustica suo quoque tempore faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:25:section=3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2, 25, § 3</bibl></cit> (al. quaeque)—</sense><sense id="n47174.122" n="c" level="4"> In the order quisque ... suus. </sense><sense id="n47174.123" n="(a)" level="5"> In relative clauses, comparative clauses with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, and interrogative clauses introduced by quid, etc., where quisque immediately follows the relative, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque suom volt esse, ita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:18:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 18, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expendere oportere quid quisque habeat sui ... nec velle experiri quam se aliena deceant. Id enim maxime quemque decet quod est cujusque maxime suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque solum quid in senatu quisque civitatis suae dicerent ignorabant, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratius id fore laetiusque quod quisque suā manu ex hoste captum rettulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 20, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 25, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus cum multa sint quae sua quisque dicere velit, nihil est quod quisque suum possit dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 23:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 23, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.124" n="(b)" level="5"> If the emphasis is not on suus, but (for quisque, when emphatic, unusquisque is used) on some other word: <cit><quote lang="la">in civitates quemque suas ... dimisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 48, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in patriam quisque suam remissus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 33, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vestigio quemque suo vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 22, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitibus quisque suis scribebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 45, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro facultatibus quisque suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 53, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">respiciendae sunt cuique facultates suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitat quisque vitam suam et futuri desiderio laborat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 7:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 7, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc praeceps quisque se proripit et penates suos deserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:5:18:8" default="NO">5, 18, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum quisque causae suae judicem facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 10: aestimatione nocturnae <pb n="1828" /> <cb n="SUUS" /> quietis, dimidio quisque spatio vitae suae vivit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 167</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.125" n="(g)" level="5"> Poets adopt the order quisque suus when the metre requires it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 743</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula quisque suae matri tulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:715" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 715</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.126" n="(d)" level="5"> When suus and quisque belong to different clauses: <cit><quote lang="la">atque earum quaeque, suum tenens munus . . . manet in lege naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.127" n="d" level="4"> Suus uterque, or uterque suus, distributively of two subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">suas uterque legiones reducit in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo quod uterque suam legem confirmare debebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sui utrosque adhortarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad utrumque ducem sui redierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utraque (lex) suā viā it,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">uterque, in apposit.: nec ipsi tam inter se acriter contenderunt, quam studia excitaverant uterque sui corporis hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 48, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.128" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">sibi.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47174.129" n="(a)" level="5"> Sibi with pronom. force (cf. sui, IV. C. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">reddam suum sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 119</bibl></cit> ( = ei; but referred to <foreign lang="greek">b,</foreign> infra, by Brix ad loc.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suam rem sibi salvam sistam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem lege sibi suā curationem petet,</quote> <trans><tr>for himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 96</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">I. B. 2. b. supra): ut vindicare sibi suum fulgorem possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the formula of divorce: tuas res tibi habeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, illam suam suas res sibi habere jussit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.130" n="(b)" level="5"> With sibi redundant, to strengthen suus (anteand post-class. and colloq.): <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto serviat suo sibi patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum necabam ilico per cerebrum pinnā suā sibi, quasi turturem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 40</bibl></cit>; v. sui, IV. C. and the passages there cited.— </sense><sense id="n47174.131" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> agreeing with the subject of suus: <cit><quote lang="la">quas cum solus pertulisset ut sua unius in his gratia esset,</quote> <trans><tr>that the credit of it should belong to him alone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de suā unius sententiā omnia gerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 22, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unam Aegyptus in hoc spem habet suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—For suus ipsius, etc., v. D. 1. b. supra.—</sense><sense id="n47174.132" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">demonstr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">indef. pronn.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of his</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hers</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">postulat ut ad hanc suam praedam adjutores vos profiteamini,</quote> <trans><tr>to this booty of his</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sestius cum illo exercitu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā gravitate suā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 61, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam rem publicam illam defenderunt,</quote> <trans><tr>that republic of theirs</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 67, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in istum civem suum,</quote> <trans><tr>against this citizen of theirs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illo suo pari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te nullā suā calamitate civitas satiare potest?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitatis igitur, quin vos M. Laterensis ad suam spem aliquam delegerit,</quote> <trans><tr>for some hope of his</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 16, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam suā ullā spe quam militum impetu tractus,</quote> <trans><tr>by any hope of his</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo suo merito,</quote> <trans><tr>from no fault of theirs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse arcano cum paucis familiaribus suis colloquitur,</quote> <trans><tr>with a few of his friends</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.133" n="6" level="3"> With descriptive <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47174.134" n="(a)" level="5"> Standing before the <pos>adj.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">noun</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">suorum improbissimorum sermonum domicilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam sui dementissimi consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam insatiabilem crudelitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis amplissimis fortunis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum pristinum morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis lenissimis postulatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: simili ratione Pompeius in suis veteribus castris consedit (suis emphatic; cf. <foreign lang="greek">b,</foreign> infra), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.135" n="(b)" level="5"> Between the <pos>adj.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">noun</hi> (less emphatic): <cit><quote lang="la">pro eximiis suis beneficiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter summam suam humanitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex praeteritis suis officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar in veteribus suis castris consedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.136" n="(g)" level="5"> After <pos>adj.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">noun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem amicum suum excepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illo ardenti tribunatu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 54, 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.137" n="7" level="3"> Objectively for the <hi rend="ital">pers. pron.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">neque cuiquam mortalium injuriae suae parvae videntur ( = sibi illatae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">neglectam ab Scipione et nimis leviter latam suam injuriam ratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsae enim leges te a cognitione suā judicio publico reppulerunt ( = a se cognoscendo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam invidiam tali morte quaesitam ( = quaesitum esse ab eo ut homines se inviderent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nulla sua invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 15, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.138" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Abl. fem.</hi> suā, with <hi rend="ital">refert</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interest</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of the <hi rend="ital">pers. pron.</hi>: neminem esse qui quomodo se habeat nihil suā censeat interesse, Cic. <cb n="SYCO" /> Fin. 5, 10, 30: <cit><quote lang="la">si scit suā nihil interesse utrum anima per os, an per jugulum exeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 33</bibl></cit>; v. intersum, III.—</sense><sense id="n47174.139" n="9" level="3"> Strengthened by the suffix <hi rend="ital">-pte</hi> or <hi rend="ital">-met.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47174.140" n="(a)" level="5"> By <hi rend="ital">-pte</hi> (not used with ipse) affixed to the forms suā, suo, and (ante-class.) suum: <cit><quote lang="la">quom illa osculata esset suumpte amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut terrena suopte nutu et suo pondere in terram ferantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri suopte pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:25:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 25, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suāpte naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suāpte vi et natura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 22, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suopte ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 18, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suāpte manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus suāpte naturā infestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">suāpte naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina suāpte naturā vasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:27:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 27, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:17:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 4, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte suāpte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:7:section=70" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 7, § 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.141" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">-met</hi>, almost always followed by ipse (in all forms of suus except suus, suum, suae, and suorum): <cit><quote lang="la">suomet ipsi more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suomet ipsi instrumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suomet ipsi metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suāmet ipsum pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suamet ipsae fraude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra suamet ipsum moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suismet ipsi praesidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suismet ipsis corporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suosmet ipsi cives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suasmet ipse spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Without ipse: <cit><quote lang="la">populum suimet sanguinis mercede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:41:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 41, 25</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">magna pars suismet aut proxumorum telis obtruncabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 52</bibl></cit> ib.</sense></entryFree>
syagrus: <entryFree id="n47175" type="greek" key="sy^a^grus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syăgrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/agros,</foreign> <sense id="n47175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of palm-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sybaris: <entryFree id="n47176" type="main" key="Sy^ba^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sybăris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*su/baris.</foreign> <sense id="n47176.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Magna Græcia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noted for the effeminacy and debauchery of its inhabitants</hi>, afterwards called Thurii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 22, 22, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 11, 15, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 51</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47176.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sybărīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Sybaris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Sybarite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:25:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47176.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sybărītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sybaris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sybaritan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47176.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sybărītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Sybaris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sybaritan</hi>: libelli, <hi rend="ital">Sybaritan</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lewd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:96:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 96, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47176.4" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sybărītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a lascivious poem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:417" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 417</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47176.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47176.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The river on which Sybaris was situated</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Coscile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 15, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 315</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47176.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a young man; acc.</hi> Sybarin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sybota: <entryFree id="n47177" type="hapax" key="Sy^bo^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sybŏta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*su/bota,</foreign> <sense id="n47177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">islands between Epirus and Corfu</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sybotes: <entryFree id="n47178" type="main" key="sy^bo_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sybōtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">subw/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n47178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swineherd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 126" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sycaminus: <entryFree id="n47179" type="greek" key="sy_ca^mi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳcămīnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">suka/minos,</foreign> <sense id="n47179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mulberry-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 18, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 184</bibl>.—Called <orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳcă-mīnon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 10</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳcŏ-mŏrus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 7, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syce: <entryFree id="n47180" type="greek" key="sy_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sukh=.</foreign> <sense id="n47180.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> peplis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 93, § 119</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47180.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The resin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rosin of the torch-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47180.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A constantly running sore in the corner of the eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 21, § 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sychaeus: <entryFree id="n47181" type="main" key="Sy_^chaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sȳ^chaeus</orth> (Sych-, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 343</bibl>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭchaeus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Sychæus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husband of Dido</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 343</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 720</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 20</bibl>; 4, 502; 4, 632; 6, 474; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:97 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 97 sq.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sy-chaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Sychæus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 552</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sycion: <entryFree id="n47182" type="main" key="sy_ci^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳcĭon agron</orth>, <sense id="n47182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> cucumis anguinus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sycites: <entryFree id="n47183" type="greek" key="sy_ci_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳcītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">suki/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n47183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fig-wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sycitis: <entryFree id="n47184" type="greek" key="sy_ci_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳcītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">suki=tis,</foreign> <sense id="n47184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of the color of figs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sycomorus: <entryFree id="n47185" type="main" key="sy_co^mo^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳcŏmŏrus</orth>, v. sycaminus.</entryFree>
sycophanta: <entryFree id="n47186" type="greek" key="sy_co^phanta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳcŏphanta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sūc-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sukofa/nths</foreign> (orig. a fig-informer, i. e. one who informed against those who exported figs from Attica contrary to law; hence, in gen.), <sense id="n47186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an informer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tale-bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">backbiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slanderer; a deceiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trickster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi> (anteand post-class.; cf.: calumniator, quadruplator). </sense><sense id="n47186.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucophanta et subdolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 28 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:32" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47186.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cunning flatterer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parasite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sycophant</hi> (syn.: planus,<cb n="SYMA" />  scurra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sycophantia: <entryFree id="n47187" type="greek" key="sy_co^phanti_^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳcŏphantī^a</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sūc-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sukofantia,</foreign> <sense id="n47187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">craft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceit; sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucophantia atque doli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 172</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sycophantiose: <entryFree id="n47188" type="hapax" key="sy_co^phanti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳcŏphantĭōsē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sūc-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>sycophanta</etym>, <sense id="n47188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">craftily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knavishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere quicquam (with malefice),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sycophantor: <entryFree id="n47189" type="main" key="sy_co^phantor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳcŏphantor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sūc-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n47189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to play the rogue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi> (Plautinian): <cit><quote lang="la">ego nunc sucophantae huic sucophantari volo,</quote> <trans><tr>I have a mind to trick this trickster</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc me sucophantari pudet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sycophyllon: <entryFree id="n47190" type="greek" key="sy_co^phyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳcŏphyllon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">suko/fullon,</foreign> <sense id="n47190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marsh-mallows</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sycurium: <entryFree id="n47191" type="main" key="Sycurium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sycurium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:56" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 56</bibl> sq. al.</sense></entryFree>
sycussa: <entryFree id="n47192" type="main" key="Sycussa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sycussa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 38, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sydraci: <entryFree id="n47193" type="main" key="Sydraci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sydraci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 6, 12, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syene: <entryFree id="n47194" type="main" key="Sy^e_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*suh/nh,</foreign> <sense id="n47194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town at the southern extremity of Upper Egypt</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Essouan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 73, 75, § 183</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:79" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 587</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:234" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 234</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:36:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 36, 7</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the granite of Syene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Syenite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 27</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syē-nītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Syene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Syenite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phorbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of red granite</tr>, <tr>Syenite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 13, § 63</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syēnītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Syene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Syenites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sygambri: <entryFree id="n47195" type="main" key="Sy^gambri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sygambri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Sigambri.</entryFree>
sygaros: <entryFree id="n47196" type="main" key="Sygaros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sygaros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island of Arabia.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syleum: <entryFree id="n47197" type="main" key="Sy^le_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sylēum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Syllēum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*su/leion,</foreign> <sense id="n47197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stronghold in Pamphylia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 14, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sylla: <entryFree id="n47198" type="main" key="Sylla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sylla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Sulla.</entryFree>
syllaba: <entryFree id="n47199" type="greek" key="sylla^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syllăba</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sul-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sullabh/,</foreign> <sense id="n47199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a syllable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47199.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllaba brevior aut longior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabarum numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllaba longa brevi subjecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllaba prima brevis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:13" default="NO">7, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:88:42" default="NO">88, 42</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisconsultus, auceps syllabarum,</quote> <trans><tr>a word-catcher</tr>, <tr>captious critic</tr>, <tr>caviller</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 236</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n47199.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">verses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poems</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verona docti syllabas amat vatis (i. e. Catulli),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:62:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 62, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
syllabatim: <entryFree id="n47200" type="main" key="sylla^ba_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syllăbātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>syllaba</etym>, <sense id="n47200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">syllable by syllable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by syllables</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui dictare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid alicui dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
syllabice: <entryFree id="n47201" type="main" key="sylla^bi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syllăbĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in respect to syllables</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in increasing the number of them</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepositiones abundant syllabice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 14, p. 983</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
syllabus: <entryFree id="n47202" type="greek" key="sylla^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syllăbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/llabos,</foreign> <sense id="n47202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a list</hi>, <hi rend="ital">register</hi>, <hi rend="ital">syllabus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 13:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 13, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syllepsis: <entryFree id="n47203" type="greek" key="syllepsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syllepsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/llhyis,</foreign> <sense id="n47203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grammatical figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which one word is referred to another in the sentence to which it does not grammatically belong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a syllepsis</hi> (e. g. hic arma, Hic currus fuit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 3</bibl>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 250</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 440</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
sylleum: <entryFree id="n47204" type="main" key="Sylle_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syllēum</orth>, v. Syleum.</entryFree>
syllogismaticus: <entryFree id="n47205" type="greek" key="syllo^gisma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syllŏgismătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sullogismatiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of syllogisms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">syllogistic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">breviloquium Aristotelis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
syllogismus: <entryFree id="n47206" type="greek" key="syllo^gismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syllŏgismus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth> (syllogismus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Pan. 205</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sullogismo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a form of reasoning in which a conclusion is drawn from two premises</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a syllogism</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:8:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:113:26" default="NO">113, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:77" default="NO">3, 6, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:88" default="NO">3, 6, 88</bibl>; 3, 6, 103; 5, 10, 88; 5, 14, 14 al.</sense></entryFree>
syllogisticus: <entryFree id="n47207" type="greek" key="syllo^gisti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syllŏgistĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sullogistiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a syllogism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">syllogistic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cicero) statum syllogisticum ratiocinativum appellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">syllŏgistĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">syllogistically</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in syllogisms</hi>, Boëth. Arist. Anal. Post. 1, 9, p. 530.</sense></entryFree>
syllus: <entryFree id="n47208" type="main" key="Syllus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syllus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a general</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 51, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sylva: <entryFree id="n47209" type="main" key="sylva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sylva</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sylvānus</orth>, etc., v. silva, etc.</entryFree>
symaethum: <entryFree id="n47210" type="main" key="Sy^maethum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Symaethum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Symaethus</orth> <pb n="1829" /> <cb n="SYMP" /> <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*su/maiqos,</foreign> <sense id="n47210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river and town situated upon it on the east coast of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Catina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:231" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:410" default="NO">9, 410</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 584</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47210.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sȳ^-maethĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Symæthus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Symæthian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 584</bibl></cit>: heros, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Acis</hi>, son of the nymph of the Symæthus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:879" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 879</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Symaethĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dwellers on the Symæthus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47210.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Symae-thēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Symæthian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:472" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 472</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47210.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Symaethis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Symæthian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 750</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
symbola: <entryFree id="n47211" type="greek" key="symbo^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">symbŏla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sumb-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sumbolh/,</foreign> <sense id="n47211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contribution</hi> of money to a feast, <hi rend="ital">a share</hi> of a reckoning, one's <hi rend="ital">scot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shot</hi>, = collecta (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n47211.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumbolarum collatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumbolam dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot adulescentuli coimus in Piraeeo In hunc diem, ut de sumbolis essemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47211.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of blows: <cit><quote lang="la">sine meo sumptu paratae jam sunt scapulis sumbolae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of entertaining topics of conversation,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:13:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 13, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
symbolice: <entryFree id="n47212" type="main" key="symbo^li^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">symbŏlĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>symbolum</etym>, <sense id="n47212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">figuratively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">symbolically</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">appellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
symbolus: <entryFree id="n47213" type="greek" key="symbo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">symbŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">symbŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47213.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), = <foreign lang="greek">su/mbolos</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">-on,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a sign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mark</hi> by which one gives another to understand any thing, <hi rend="ital">a token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">symbol</hi> (mostly anteand post-class.): per symbolos pecunias capere, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Antonin. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Antonin. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum Graeci a digitis appellavere: apud nos prisci ungulum vocabant: postea et Graeci et nostri symbolum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a signet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles hic reliquit symbolum, Expressam in cerā ex anulo suo imaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:53 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 53 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 26</bibl> sq.; 2, 2, 4; 4, 7, 15; 4, 7, 106; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum quae pacta sunt symbola,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istic symbolum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47213.1" n="II" level="1"> = symbola, q. v.: <cit><quote lang="la">vacantes potibus et dantes symbola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 23, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
syme: <entryFree id="n47214" type="hapax" key="Syme_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Symē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*su/mh,</foreign> <sense id="n47214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island of the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Rhodes and Cnidos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 36, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
symmachus: <entryFree id="n47215" type="main" key="Symma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Symmăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Q. Aurelius, <sense id="n47215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consul and prefect of Rome towards the end of the fourth century</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished as an orator and author of</hi> Epistulae <hi rend="ital">in ten books</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still extant;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 1, § 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 17</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Symmăchĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Symmachus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud dictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
symmetria: <entryFree id="n47216" type="greek" key="symme_^tri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">symmē^trĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">summetri/a,</foreign> <sense id="n47216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">symmetry</hi> (cf. congruentia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19</bibl>, §§ 58 and 65; 35, 10, 36, § 67.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
symmetros: <entryFree id="n47217" type="greek" key="symme_^tros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">symmē^tros</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/mmetros,</foreign> <sense id="n47217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">symmetrical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualitas eurythmiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
symmysta: <entryFree id="n47218" type="greek" key="symmysta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">symmysta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">summu/sths,</foreign> <sense id="n47218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-priest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colleague in the priesthood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 310</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 58, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">66, 9</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:533" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 533</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sympasma: <entryFree id="n47219" type="greek" key="sympasma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sympasma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/mpasma;</foreign> in medicine, <sense id="n47219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a powder for sprinkling over the body</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:38:218 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 38, 218 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sympathia: <entryFree id="n47220" type="greek" key="sympa^thi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sympăthīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sumpa/qeia,</foreign> <sense id="n47220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a feeling in common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sympathy</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 458, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:147" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 9, 41, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:59" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 4, 15, § 59</bibl> (by Cic. written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
symphonia: <entryFree id="n47221" type="greek" key="sympho_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">symphōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sumfwni/a,</foreign> <sense id="n47221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an agreement of sounds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">symphony.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47221.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum symphonia caneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 13, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:84" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 29, 43, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:E 12:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> E 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 374</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18 al.</bibl>—Of <hi rend="ital">a signal</hi> in war, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> ad Symm. 2, 527</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47221.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in late Lat., <hi rend="ital">a kind of musical instrument</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 21, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
symphoniacus: <entryFree id="n47222" type="main" key="sympho_ni^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">symphōnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sumfwniako/s.</foreign> <sense id="n47222.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to concerts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to music</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>singingboys</tr>, <tr>choristers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 21, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47222.1" n="II" level="1"> Herba, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> hyoscyamos, <hi rend="ital">henbane</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 12</bibl>. 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 4</bibl>. <cb n="SYNC" /></sense></entryFree>
symphyton: <entryFree id="n47223" type="greek" key="symphy^ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">symphyton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/mfuton.</foreign> <sense id="n47223.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Wallwort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comfrey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boneset</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 6, 24, § 41</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47223.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> helenion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
symplegades: <entryFree id="n47224" type="main" key="Symple_ga^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Symplēgădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sumplhga/des</foreign> (that strike together). <sense id="n47224.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Two rocky islands in the Euxine that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to the fable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">floated about dashing against and rebounding from each other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">until at length they became fixed on the passage of the Argo between them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 12, 13, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 338</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 19" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 19</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number> Symplegas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:221" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:718" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 718</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Symplegados, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:300" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 300</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Symplegada, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47224.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">symplēgas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; as an appellative, <hi rend="ital">a joining together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cohesion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebente algam densi symplegade limi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Itin. 1, 461</bibl></cit>.—Of the buttocks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:99:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 99, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 108, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
symplegma: <entryFree id="n47225" type="greek" key="symplegma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">symplegma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/mplegma</foreign> (a twining together), <sense id="n47225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a group</hi> of persons embracing or wrestling, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4</bibl>, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">24 and 35.—In mal. part.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:43:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 43, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 239</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
symploce: <entryFree id="n47226" type="greek" key="symplo^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">symplŏcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sumplokh/</foreign> (an interweaving); gram. t. t., <sense id="n47226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figure of speech where the same word is often repeated</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 534</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
symposiacus: <entryFree id="n47227" type="greek" key="sympo^si^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sympŏsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sumposiako/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a banquet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convivial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">symposiac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiunculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit> tit. (al. sympoticae).—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sympŏ-sĭăca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the writings of Plutarch entitled</hi> Symposium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11:6" default="NO">17, 11, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
symposium: <entryFree id="n47228" type="greek" key="Sympo^si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sympŏsĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sumpo/sion</foreign> (The Banquet), <sense id="n47228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of one of Plato</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s dialogues</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 2, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">A dialogue of Xenophon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sympoticus: <entryFree id="n47229" type="main" key="sympo^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sympŏtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sumpotiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">convivial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiunculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit> tit.</sense></entryFree>
sympsalma: <entryFree id="n47230" type="greek" key="sympsalma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sympsalma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/myalma,</foreign> <sense id="n47230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a playing together</hi> of music, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 4:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
