synagoga: <entryFree id="n47231" type="greek" key="sy^na^go_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synăgōga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sunagwgh/,</foreign> <sense id="n47231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a congregation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">synagogue</hi> of Jews, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 22</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:159" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synaloephe: <entryFree id="n47232" type="greek" key="sy^na^loephe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synăloephē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-līphē</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-loepha</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sunaloifh/,</foreign> <sense id="n47232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the contraction of two syllables into one</hi>, either by synæresis or by crasis; <cit><quote lang="la">in later gram. applied esp. to elision, = collisio, elisio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:109" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 249</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 437</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 267</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synanche: <entryFree id="n47233" type="greek" key="sy^nanche_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synanchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">suna/gxh,</foreign> <sense id="n47233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inflammation of the throat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sore-throat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quinsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 38, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synanchicus: <entryFree id="n47234" type="greek" key="sy^nanchi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synanchĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sunagxiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a soreness of the throat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">passio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:25:140" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 25, 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
synapothnescontes: <entryFree id="n47235" type="main" key="Sy^na^pothnescontes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Synăpothnescontes</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">sunapoqnh/skontes</foreign> (who die together), <sense id="n47235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy by Diphilus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 6</bibl> Fleck.</sense></entryFree>
synaristosae: <entryFree id="n47236" type="greek" key="Syna^risto_sae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Synăristōsae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sunaristw=sai,</foreign> <sense id="n47236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the women breakfasting together</hi>, the title of a comedy by Menander, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 9, 81, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 370, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synaxis: <entryFree id="n47237" type="greek" key="sy^naxis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synaxis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/nacis,</foreign> <sense id="n47237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gathering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collecting</hi>, Ven. Carm. 8, 17.</sense></entryFree>
syncerastum: <entryFree id="n47238" type="greek" key="synce^rastum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syncĕrastum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sugkerasto/n,</foreign> <sense id="n47238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dish composed of a variety of ingredients</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hotch-potch</hi>: Plautus in Phagone: honos syncerasto perit, pernis, glandio; <cit><quote lang="la">syncerastum est omnimodum edulium, antiquo vocabulo Graeco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 61</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
synchrisma: <entryFree id="n47239" type="greek" key="synchrisma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synchrisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype> (<sense id="n47239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> -mae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 18</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/gxrisma,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">an anointing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 45</bibl>; Pelag. Vet. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
synchronus: <entryFree id="n47240" type="main" key="synchro^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synchrŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/gxronos,</foreign> <sense id="n47240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">synchronic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary</hi>, Hier. Com. in XII. Proph. praef.</sense></entryFree>
syncope: <entryFree id="n47241" type="greek" key="synco^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syncŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">syncŏpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sugkoph/.</foreign> <sense id="n47241.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fainting away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swooning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">syncope</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47241.1" n="II" level="1"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">the omission of a letter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">syllable in the middle of a word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">syncope</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 248</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 436</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
syncopo: <entryFree id="n47242" type="main" key="synco^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syncŏpo</orth>, no <sense id="n47242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>syncope, I.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to faint away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swoon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syncrasis: <entryFree id="n47243" type="greek" key="syncra_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syncrāsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/gkrasis,</foreign> <sense id="n47243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mingling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blending</hi>, one of the Æons, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 8</bibl>. <cb n="SYNO" /></sense></entryFree>
syndicus: <entryFree id="n47244" type="greek" key="syndi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syndĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/ndikos,</foreign> <sense id="n47244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a representative of a corporation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a syndic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 4, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:1" default="NO">50, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=13" default="NO">50, 4, 18, § 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synecdoche: <entryFree id="n47245" type="greek" key="sy^necdo^che_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synecdŏchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sunekdoxh/,</foreign> <sense id="n47245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figure of speech by which a part is put for the whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the cause for the effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or the contrary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a proper for a common noun</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">synecdoche</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:18 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 18 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:28" default="NO">8, 6, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 245</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 453</bibl> ib. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 58</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
synecdochice: <entryFree id="n47246" type="main" key="sy^necdo^chi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synecdŏchĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>synecdoche</etym>, <sense id="n47246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by synecdoche</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">synecdochice intellegitur totum ex parte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> 2</bibl></cit> in Matt. 12, 40.</sense></entryFree>
synecticus: <entryFree id="n47247" type="greek" key="sy^necti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synectĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sunektiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fit for maintaining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>efficient</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:15" default="NO">3, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synedrus: <entryFree id="n47248" type="greek" key="sy^ne^drus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synĕdrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/nedros,</foreign> <sense id="n47248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a counsellor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senator</hi>, among the Macedonians (Lat. senator), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 32, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synemmenon: <entryFree id="n47249" type="greek" key="sy^ne_mme^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synēmmĕnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sunhmme/non</foreign> (conjoined), <sense id="n47249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a certain series of musical sounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synephebi: <entryFree id="n47250" type="greek" key="Sy^ne^phe_bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Synĕphēbi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sune/fhboi,</foreign> <sense id="n47250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The Fellow-youths</hi>, the title of a comedy by Statius Caecilius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 6, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synesis: <entryFree id="n47251" type="greek" key="sy^ne^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/nesis,</foreign> <sense id="n47251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">understanding</hi>, one of the Æons, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syngenicos: <entryFree id="n47252" type="greek" key="synge^ni^cos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syngĕnĭcos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">suggeniko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s family</hi> or <hi rend="ital">race</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 134</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syngrapha: <entryFree id="n47253" type="greek" key="syngra^pha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syngrăpha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">suggrafh/,</foreign> <sense id="n47253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a written agreement to pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a promissory note</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bond</hi> (cf. chirographum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:11 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:13:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 13, § 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex syngraphā agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 17, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syngraphus: <entryFree id="n47254" type="greek" key="syngra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syngrăphus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sungr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/ggrafos.</foreign> <sense id="n47254.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A written contract</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47254.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A passport</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synhietae: <entryFree id="n47255" type="main" key="Synhie_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Synhiētae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Asia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synicense: <entryFree id="n47256" type="main" key="Synicense"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Synicense</orth> <itype>Castellum</itype>, <sense id="n47256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress in Numidia</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 8.</sense></entryFree>
synizesis: <entryFree id="n47257" type="greek" key="sy^ni_ze_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synīzēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">suni/zhsis,</foreign> <sense id="n47257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contraction of two vowels into one syllable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 698</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synnada: <entryFree id="n47258" type="main" key="Synna^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Synnăda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Phrygia Major</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for its marble</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Afioum Karahissar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 1</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Synnăda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 273</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syn-nas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:76:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 76, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:37" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 105</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47258.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Synnădensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> Synnada: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47258.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Synnădĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Synnadic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47258.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Synnas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Synnadic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <trans><tr>of Synnadic marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. III. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
synnephitis: <entryFree id="n47259" type="main" key="synne^phi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synnĕphītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for the gem</hi> galactitis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 162</bibl> (al. synophites).</sense></entryFree>
synochitis: <entryFree id="n47260" type="greek" key="syno^chi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synŏchītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sunoxi=tis,</foreign> <sense id="n47260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of precious stone now unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 192</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synodalis: <entryFree id="n47261" type="main" key="sy^no^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synŏdālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>synodus</etym>, <sense id="n47261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a synod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">synodal</hi>: Nemausum, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:415" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 415</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">synŏ-dālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">constitutions of a synod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">synodals</hi>, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:423" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 423</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
synodicus: <entryFree id="n47262" type="greek" key="sy^no^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synŏdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sunodiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">going</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coming together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">synodical</hi>: luna, i. e. <hi rend="ital">when in conjunction with the sun</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 6; 4 praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n47262.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">According to the decrees of the synod</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 13</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">synŏdĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in accordance with the synod</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s decrees</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 4, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

synodus: <entryFree id="n47265" type="greek" key="sy^no^dus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synŏdus</orth> (in inscrr. written also SYNHODVS; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. synthesis: <entryFree id="n47278" type="greek" key="synthe^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">synthĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/nqesis</foreign> (a putting together). <sense id="n47278.0" n="I" level="1"> In medicine, <hi rend="ital">a mixture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compound</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 30, 578</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">61, 1069</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47278.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">service of plate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:46:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 46, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:44" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47278.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a set of wearing-apparel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suit of clothes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:46:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 46, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47278.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy garment</hi> worn at table, <hi rend="ital">a loose gown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dressing-gown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:79:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 79, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:1:1" default="NO">1, 1, 1</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 52</bibl>: synthesina vestis); cf. Becker, Antiq. vol. 3, p. 124 sq.</sense></entryFree>

syrbotae: <entryFree id="n47286" type="main" key="Syrbotae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrbotae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Ethiopia<cb n="SYRO" />  remarkable for stature</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 2, § 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syreon: <entryFree id="n47287" type="greek" key="syre^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syrĕon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/reon,</foreign> <sense id="n47287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> tordylion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 117, § 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syria: <entryFree id="n47288" type="main" key="Sy_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sȳrĭa</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭrĭa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭ-rĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*suri/a,</foreign> <sense id="n47288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country in Asia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Mediterranean Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 41, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 622</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">Assyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:35:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 35, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 22</bibl> Oud.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:45:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 45, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:22:7:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 22, 7, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:3" default="NO">50, 15, 3</bibl> proöem.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n47288.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Syria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Syrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 49, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>nard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 30</bibl> (3, 5, 14): dea, perh. <hi rend="ital">Cybele</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Non. 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 213, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1946 sq.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Syrians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 26, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47288.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrus</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭrus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Syrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lagena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:46:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 46, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 62</bibl></cit> et saep.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Syrians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:33:section=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 33, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 265</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n47288.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Syrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicani,</quote> <trans><tr>doing business in Syria</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:11" default="NO">2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:12" default="NO">2, 12</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrĭăcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the Syrian tongue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:18:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 18, 26</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n47288.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Syrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47288.5" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrĭātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Syrian</hi>: calami, Pelag. Vet. 27.—</sense><sense id="n47288.6" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syriscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Syria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Syrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Copa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cop. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
syriarcha: <entryFree id="n47289" type="main" key="Sy^ri^archa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrĭarcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*suria/rxhs,</foreign> <sense id="n47289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief priest</hi> in Syria, Cod. Th. 15, 9, 2; called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrĭarchus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Nov. 89:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Nov. 89, 15</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">His office</hi> is called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrĭarchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*suriarxi/a,</foreign> Cod. Th. 12, 1, 103.</sense></entryFree>
syriaticus: <entryFree id="n47290" type="main" key="Sy^ri^a_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrĭātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Syria, E.</entryFree>
syricus: <entryFree id="n47291" type="main" key="Sy^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Syria, D.</entryFree>
syrie: <entryFree id="n47292" type="main" key="Syri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near Ephesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 89, 91, § 204</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syringias: <entryFree id="n47293" type="greek" key="sy_ringi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳringĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">suriggi/as,</foreign> <sense id="n47293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of reed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cane good for pipes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syringitis: <entryFree id="n47294" type="greek" key="sy_ringi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳringītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">suriggi=tis,</foreign> <sense id="n47294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown kind of precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 182</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syringnatus: <entryFree id="n47295" type="hapax" key="sy_ringna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳringnātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sȳringiānus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>syrinx</etym>, <sense id="n47295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hollowed out like a pipe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:6" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
syringotomium: <entryFree id="n47296" type="greek" key="sy_ringo^to^mi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳringŏtŏmĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">suriggoto/mion,</foreign> <sense id="n47296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surgical instrument for cutting fistulas</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 27, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syrinx: <entryFree id="n47297" type="greek" key="Sy_rinx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sȳrinx</orth>, <itype>ingis</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sȳringa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 26</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*su/rigc.</foreign> <sense id="n47297.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A nymph changed into a reed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:691 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 691 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n47297.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳringes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">caverns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subterraneous passages</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 7, 11 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
syriscus: <entryFree id="n47298" type="main" key="Sy^riscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syriscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Syria, F.</entryFree>

syrius: <entryFree id="n47300" type="main" key="Sy_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sȳrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Syria, A.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n47301" type="main" key="Sy_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sȳrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Syros.</entryFree>
syrma: <entryFree id="n47302" type="greek" key="syrma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syrma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n47302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:229" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 474" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 474</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">su/rma.</foreign> </sense><sense id="n47302.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A robe with a train</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oed. 423" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oed. 423</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 362</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">worn esp. by trag. actors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:229" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 229</bibl></cit>; Val. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679</bibl> P.; Sid. poët. Ep. 8, 11.—</sense><sense id="n47302.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">tragedy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:95:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 95, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:49:8" default="NO">4, 49, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:30" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syrmatae: <entryFree id="n47303" type="main" key="Syrma^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrmătae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Asia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syrmaticus: <entryFree id="n47304" type="greek" key="syrma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syrmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">surmatiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dragging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trailing along</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumentum,</quote> <trans><tr>limping</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
syrnos: <entryFree id="n47305" type="main" key="Syrnos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Sporades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syron: <entryFree id="n47306" type="main" key="syron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for the plant</hi> molon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 19, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syrophoenix: <entryFree id="n47307" type="main" key="Sy^ro^phoenix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrŏphoenix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*surofoi/nic,</foreign> <sense id="n47307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Syrophœnician</hi> (on the borders of Syria and Phœnicia), Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 397, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:159 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 159 sq.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrŏphoenissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 5, 23, 12</bibl>. <cb n="T" /></sense></entryFree>
syros: <entryFree id="n47308" type="main" key="Sy_ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sȳros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*su=ros,</foreign> <sense id="n47308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Cyclades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Delos and Paros</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Syra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 12, 22, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 175</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sȳrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Syros</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 56, § 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
syrtis: <entryFree id="n47309" type="main" key="Syrtis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrtis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n47309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Syrtidos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 710</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*su/rtis,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a sand-bank</hi> in the sea; esp. on the northern coast of Africa, Syrtis Major, <hi rend="ital">near Cyrenaica</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gulf of Sidra;</hi> and Syrtis minor, <hi rend="ital">near Byzacene</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gulf of Cabes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 78:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 78, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:62" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:91" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 303</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:861" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 861</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 511</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47309.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">videndum est, ne longe simile sit ductum. Syrtim patrimonii, scopulum libentius dixerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 163</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47309.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrtĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Syrtis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Syrtian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 11, 11, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47309.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Syr-tis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Syrtian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 183</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
syrus: <entryFree id="n47310" type="hapax" key="syrus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">syrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a broom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besom</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 46, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n47311" type="main" key="Syrus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Syria, B.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47312" type="main" key="Sy^rus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Syrus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">i</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 69</bibl>.—Of a <hi rend="ital">dog of Actæon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 187" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
systalticus: <entryFree id="n47313" type="greek" key="systalti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">systaltĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sustaltiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drawing together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tropi in rhythmopoeia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 994</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
systema: <entryFree id="n47314" type="greek" key="syste_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">systēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/sthma,</foreign> <sense id="n47314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whole consisting of several parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a complex whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a system</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9</bibl>, §§ 947, 953; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
systylos: <entryFree id="n47315" type="greek" key="systy_los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">systȳlos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/stulos</foreign> (closecolumned); <sense id="n47315.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in architecture,</quote> <trans><tr>an arrangement of columns at a distance from each other of twice their thickness</tr>, <tr>a systyle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
syzygia: <entryFree id="n47316" type="greek" key="sy_zy^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sȳzygĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">suzugi/a</foreign> (pure Lat. conjugatio), <sense id="n47316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conjunction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a syzygy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 46</bibl>. <cb n="T." /></sense></entryFree>
t: <entryFree id="n47317" type="main" key="T"><orth extent="full" lang="la">T</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">t</orth>. <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen> or (to agree with littera) <gen>f.</gen>, the nineteenth letter of the Lat. alphabet (<sense id="n47317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">i</hi> and <hi rend="ital">j</hi> being counted as one), = Gr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">T</orth> (<foreign lang="greek">tau=</foreign>). It is very freq. as a final letter, esp. in verbal endings of the third person. </sense><sense id="n47317.1" n="I" level="1"> As an initial, it is, in pure Lat. words, followed by no consonant except <hi rend="ital">r</hi>: traho, tremo, tribuo, etc.; the combinations <hi rend="ital">tl</hi> and <hi rend="ital">tm</hi> are found only in words borrowed from the Greek: Tlepolemus, tmesis, Tmolus. Hence an initial <hi rend="ital">t</hi> occurring in the ancient language before <hi rend="ital">l</hi> (like an initial <hi rend="ital">d</hi> before <hi rend="ital">v</hi>, v. letter D) is rejected in classical Lat.: lātus (<mood>Part.</mood> of fero) for tlatus, from root tol- of tollo, tuli; cf. with <foreign lang="greek">*t*l*a*w, tlhto/s;</foreign> even when softened by a sibilant, the combination of <hi rend="ital">t</hi> and <hi rend="ital">l</hi> in stlata (genus navigii), stlembus (gravis, tardus), stlis, stlocus, was avoided, and, except in the formal lang. of law, which retained stlitibus judicandis, the forms lis, locus remained the only ones in use, though the transitional form slis occurs twice in very old inscriptions. Before a vowel or <hi rend="ital">r</hi>, the original Indo-European <hi rend="ital">t</hi> always retained its place and character. Between two vowels <hi rend="ital">t</hi> and <hi rend="ital">tt</hi> were freq. confounded, and in some words the double letter became established, although the original form had but one <hi rend="ital">t;</hi> thus, quattuor, cottidie, littera, stand in the best MSS. and inscriptions; v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 174 sqq.—</sense><sense id="n47317.2" n="II" level="1"> The sibilant pronunciation of a medial <hi rend="ital">t</hi> before <hi rend="ital">i</hi> and a following vowel, is a peculiarity of a late period. Isidorus (at the commencement of the seventh century after Christ) is the first who expresses himself definitely on this point: cum justitia sonum <hi rend="ital">z</hi> litterae exprimat, tamen quia Latinum est, per <hi rend="ital">t</hi> scribendum est, sicut militia, malitia, nequitia et cetera similia (Orig. 1, 26, 28); but the commutation of <hi rend="ital">ci</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ti</hi>, which occurs not unfrequently in older inscriptions, shows the origin of this change in pronunciation to have been earlier. In the golden age of the language, however, it was certainly <pb n="1831" /> <cb n="TABE" /> unknown.—</sense><sense id="n47317.3" n="III" level="1"> The aspiration of <hi rend="ital">t</hi> did not come into general use till the golden age; hence, CARTACINIENSIS, on the Columna Rostrata; whereas in Cicero we have Carthago, like Cethegus, etc.; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 160</bibl>; and cf. letter C.—</sense><sense id="n47317.4" n="IV" level="1"> T is interchanged with <hi rend="ital">d</hi>, <hi rend="ital">c</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">s;</hi> v. these letters.—</sense><sense id="n47317.5" n="V" level="1"> T is assimilated to <hi rend="ital">s</hi> in passus from patior, quassus from quatio, fassus from fateor, missus from mitto, equestris from eques (equit-), etc. It is wholly suppressed before <hi rend="ital">s</hi> in usus, from utor; in many nominatives of the third declension ending in <hi rend="ital">s</hi>: civitas (root civitat, <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> civitatis), quies (quiet, quietis), lis (lit, litis), dos (dot, dotis), salus (salut, salutis), amans (amant, amantis), mens (ment, mentis), etc.; and likewise in flexi, flexus, from flecto, and before other letters, in remus, cf. ratis; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)retmo/s;</foreign> in penna; root pat-, to fly; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pe/tomai,</foreign> etc. In late Lat. the vulgar language often dropped <hi rend="ital">t</hi> before <hi rend="ital">r</hi> and before vowels; hence such forms as mari, quaraginta, donaus, are found for matri, quatriginta (quad-), donatus, in inscriptions; cf. the French mère, quarante, donné.—</sense><sense id="n47317.6" n="VI" level="1"> As an abbreviation, T. stands for Titus; Ti. Tiberius; TR. Tribunus; T. F. Testamenti formula; T. F. C. Titulum faciendum curavit; T. P. Tribunicia potestas, etc.</sense></entryFree>
tabae: <entryFree id="n47318" type="main" key="Tabae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tabae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n47318.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the boundaries of Phrygia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Damas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47318.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in the inner part of Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:272" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 272</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47318.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Parœtacene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Persis and Media</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tabanus: <entryFree id="n47319" type="main" key="ta^ba_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gad-fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horse-fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oxfly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breese; called also</hi> asilus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:113" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 33, 38, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:101" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 11, 30, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tabefacio: <entryFree id="n47320" type="main" key="ta_be^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tabes-facio</etym>, <sense id="n47320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to melt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolve.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabefac audaciam virtutis eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilia honestatis tabefaciet carnes,</quote> <trans><tr>subdue</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 31, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tābē^factus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">melted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolved</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tabefactis nivibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadaver in suo sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 14, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tabefio: <entryFree id="n47321" type="main" key="ta_be^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābĕfīo</orth>, <itype>factus sum</itype>, <sense id="n47321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. irr. dep.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be melted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dissolved</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 38, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tabella: <entryFree id="n47322" type="main" key="ta^bella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n47322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> TABELAI, S. C. de Bacch. Corp. I. R. 196). <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tabula</etym>. </sense><sense id="n47322.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a small board</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little table</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tablet</hi> (rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">liminis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the door-sill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 32, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabella aerea,</quote> <trans><tr>a brass plate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 19</bibl></cit>: hos (libellos) eme, quos artat brevibus membrana tabellis, <hi rend="ital">little tablets</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">small pages</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva tabella capit ternos utrimque lapillos,</quote> <trans><tr>small gamingboards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 365</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2</bibl>. 481: <cit><quote lang="la">pistor multiplices struit tabellas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>thin cakes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 31, 9</bibl></cit>.—Of the basket or cradle in which Romulus and Remus were exposed: <cit><quote lang="la">heu quantum fati parva tabella vehit,</quote> <trans><tr>the little bark</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:408" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 408</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47322.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (class.). </sense><sense id="n47322.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A writing-tablet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellis pro chartis utebantur antiqui, quibus ultro citro, sive privatim sive publice opus erat, certiores absentes faciebant, unde adhuc tabellarii dicuntur: et tabellae missae ab imperatoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=359" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 359</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellae Imponere manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abiegnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras tabellae insculpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecit et Libyn puerum tenentem tabellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47322.4" n="2" level="3"> Hence, transf., in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">written composition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">letter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellas proferri jussimus ... Recitatae sunt tabellae in eandem fere sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">allatae sunt tabellae ad eam a Stratippocle, eum argentum sumpsisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tabellis jam faxo scies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellas consignare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quidem tabellis obsignatis agis mecum,</quote> <trans><tr>with sealed writings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicae Heracleensium,</quote> <trans><tr>public records</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 16, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellae quaestionis plures proferuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>minutes of evidence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:65:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 65, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur totiens video mitti recipique tabellas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rasae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiis tabellas dotis ipse consignavit,</quote> <trans><tr>the marriage contract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsas signare tabellas,</quote> <trans><tr>forged wills</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laureatae,</quote> <trans><tr>a letter announcing a victory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">testimonium per tabellam dare,</quote> <trans><tr>in writing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 36</bibl></cit>: <cb n="TABE" /> ex tabellā pronuntiare sententiam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47322.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A tablet for voting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ballot.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47322.6" n="1" level="3"> In the comitia, used in electing a magistrate or deciding upon the acceptance of a proposed law: in the former case the elector wrote down the name of a candidate; in the latter, each voter received two tablets, on one of which were the letters U. R., i. e. uti rogas, denoting approval; <cit><quote lang="la">on the other, A., i. e. antiquo (for the old law), denoting rejection: me universa civitas non prius tabellā quam voce priorem consulem declaravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ego exspectem, dum de te quinque et septuaginta tabellae dirimantur?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabella modo detur nobis, sicut populo data est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si populo grata est tabella, quae frontis aperit hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 6, 16</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47322.7" n="2" level="3"> In courts of justice; here each judge usually received three tablets; one of which, inscribed A., i. e. absolvo, denoted acquittal; another, with C., i. e. condemno, written on it, denoted condemnation; <cit><quote lang="la">and the third, with N. L., i. e. non liquet (it is not clear), left the case undecided: cum tabella vobis dabitur, judices, non de Flacco dabitur solum: dabitur de bonis omnibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 39, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic judicialis tabella committetur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:32:section=79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 32, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quibusdam etiam imperitus judex dimittere tabellam potest,</quote> <trans><tr>give his vote</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:7:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamlibet austeras de me ferat urna tabellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 49; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 83</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 33</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47322.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A painted tablet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small picture</hi> or <hi rend="ital">painting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (exhedria) volebam tabellis ornare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priscis sparsa tabellis Porticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inveniat plures nulla tabella modos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:680" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comicae tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 114</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cubicula tabellis adornavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrrhena sigilla, tabellas, Sunt qui non habeant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pausiaca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47322.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A votive tablet</hi>, hung up in a temple, and on which one acknowledged by writing or painting the favor or aid he had received from a deity: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc, dea, nunc succurre mihi, nam posse mederi, Picta docet templis multa tabella tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et posita est meritae multa tabella deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:268" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votiva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:27" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:744" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 744</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47322.10" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (ventos) faciet nostrā mota tabella manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tabellarius: <entryFree id="n47323" type="main" key="ta^bella_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbellārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tabella</etym>, <sense id="n47323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to tablets</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n47323.1" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to tabella, II.A.) <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to writing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to letters.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47323.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>vessels to carry letters</tr>, <tr>packet-boats</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 77:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 77, 1</bibl></cit>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n47323.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbellārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a lettercarrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam, quam attulerat Phileros tabellarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 31, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 7, 15</bibl>; Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:1:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 1, 6 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n47323.4" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to tabella, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to voting-tablets</hi>: lex, <hi rend="ital">regulating voting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt enim quattuor leges tabellariae, quarum prima de magistratibus mandandis, ea est tabellaria Gabinia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:16:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 16, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:48:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 48, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 20, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tabellio: <entryFree id="n47324" type="main" key="ta^belli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tabella, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n47324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who draws up written instruments</hi>, such as contracts, wills, etc., <hi rend="ital">a notary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrivener</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macr. 4</bibl>; Firm. Math. 4, 5; Cod. Th. 9, 19, 1.</sense></entryFree>
tabeo: <entryFree id="n47325" type="main" key="ta_be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>tabes</etym>, <sense id="n47325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to melt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melt down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to waste away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n47325.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis rebus concrescunt semina membris, Atque aliis extenuantur tabentque vicissim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora tabent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabentes genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabens sanies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:364" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sale tabentes artus in litore ponunt,</quote> <trans><tr>dripping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 173</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47325.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to waste away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanish</hi>: seditio tabetne an numeros augificat suos? Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 76, 2</bibl> (Trag. v. 105 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
taberna: <entryFree id="n47326" type="main" key="ta^berna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăberna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root ta (tan); Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tei/nw,</foreign> perf. <foreign lang="greek">te/taka;</foreign> cf.: tabula, tenus</etym>, <sense id="n47326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">booth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shop</hi> constructed of boards. </sense><sense id="n47326.1" n="I" level="1"> Hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">any slight structure used for a dwelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cottage</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tabernae appellatio declarat omne utile ad habitandum aedificium, non ex eo, quod tabulis cluditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:183" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperum tabernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">obscurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 229</bibl></cit>.—Of stalls in the circus: qui in circo totas tabernas tribulium causā compararunt,<cb n="TABE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 73</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n47326.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47326.3" n="A" level="2"> Of a merchant, mechanic, taverner, etc., <hi rend="ital">a booth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">workshop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tavern</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">instructam ei medicinae exercendae causā tabernam dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 63, 178</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">instructam tabernam sic accipiemus, quae et rebus et hominibus ad negotiationem paratis constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:185" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 185</bibl></cit>: taberna libraria, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a bookseller</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s shop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 9, 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so simply taberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:118:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 118, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 55</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cretaria, unguentaria, Varr. l. l.: casearia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:8:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 5, 8, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:32" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 11, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpuraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:91" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sutrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Alfenus vafer omni Abjecto instrumento artis clausaque taberna Sutor erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 131</bibl></cit>: Liparea, <hi rend="ital">Vulcan</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s shop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:45" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deversoria,</quote> <trans><tr>an inn</tr>, <tr>tavern</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauponia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in eandem tabernam devertissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occlusis tabernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursare circum tabernas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occludere tabernas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">prope Cloacinae ad tabernas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernam exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernam vel officinam conductam habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 19</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47326.4" n="B" level="2"> Tres Tabernae, <hi rend="ital">the Three Taverns</hi>, a place on the Appian Way, near Ulubrae and Forum Appii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12, 2</bibl>; 2, 13, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 28, 15</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47326.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A passage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">archway</hi> in the circus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 73</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47326.6" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae colis Durrachium Adriae tabernam,</quote> <trans><tr>the market</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 36, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tabernacularius: <entryFree id="n47327" type="gloss" key="ta^berna_cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbernācŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tabernaculum</etym>, <sense id="n47327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tent-maker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> p. 642, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tabernaculum: <entryFree id="n47328" type="main" key="ta^berna_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbernācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>taberna</etym>, <sense id="n47328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tent</hi> (syn. tentorium): <cit><quote lang="la">tabernacula dicuntur a similitudine tabernarum, quae ipsae, quod ex tabulis olim fiebant, dictae sunt, non, ut quidam putant, quod tabulis cludantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: unde (sc. a tabernis) et tabernacula sunt dicta, licet ex tentoriis pellibus fiant, id. s. v. contubernales, p. 38 ib. </sense><sense id="n47328.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernaculo in litore posito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:33:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 33, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso aditu portus tabernacula carbaseis intenta velis collocabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">30: collocassem mihi in campo Martio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 25</bibl></cit> 61: <cit><quote lang="la">militare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar eo die tabernacula statui passus non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernaculis stantibus castra reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 42, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernaculis detensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 40, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10:14" default="NO">7, 10, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in unā philosophiā quasi tabernaculum vitae suae collocarunt,</quote> <trans><tr>as it were</tr>, <tr>have pitched their tent</tr>, <tr>settled down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:20:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 20, 77</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47328.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in relig. lang.: tabernaculum capere, <hi rend="ital">to choose a place for a tent without the city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wherein to observe the auspices</hi> previous to holding the comitia: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernaculum recte captum,</quote> <trans><tr>in the proper manner</tr>, <tr>with due ceremonies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 35, 75</bibl></cit>;
